arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: selects one or more output objects for the DOCUMENT destination.

arguments.name: SHOW
arguments.description: writes the current selection or exclusion list for the destination to the SAS log.

name: ODS DOCUMENT
description: Opens, manages, or closes the DOCUMENT destination, which produces a hierarchy of output objects that enables you to produce multiple ODS output formats without rerunning a PROC or DATA step.

arguments.name: permanent-catalog
arguments.description: copies any temporary GRSEG to the specified permanent catalog and keeps a reference to the permanent GRSEG in the document. This value persists until the ODS DOCUMENT statement is closed, or until you delete it by specifying CATALOG=_NULL_.

arguments.name: _NULL_
arguments.description: deletes the catalog name that was previously specified for the CATALOG= option. Thereafter, temporary GRSEGs are not copied into the permanent catalog and thus are unavailable in subsequent sessions.

arguments.name: DIR=
arguments.description: specifies the directory path and/or label for ODS output.

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: assigns a label to a path.

arguments.name: PATH=
arguments.description: is specified as a sequence of entries that are delimited by backslashes.

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: is the name of the path.

arguments.name: #sequence–number
arguments.description: is a number which, when combined with a pathname, uniquely identifies the entry in the directory that contains it.

arguments.name: WRITE
arguments.description: opens a document and provides Write access as well as Read access.

arguments.name: UPDATE
arguments.description: opens an ODS document and appends new content to the document. UPDATE provides Update access as well as Read access.

arguments.name: libref
arguments.description: specifies the SAS library where the document is stored.

arguments.name: member-name
arguments.description: specifies the document name.

arguments.name: WRITE
arguments.description: opens a document and provides Write access as well as Read access.

arguments.name: UPDATE
arguments.description: opens an ODS document and appends new content to the document. UPDATE provides Update access as well as Read access.

arguments.name: CLOSE
arguments.description: closes the destination and any files that are associated with it.

arguments.name: EXCLUDE
arguments.description: excludes one or more output objects from the DOCUMENT destination.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: excludes one or more output objects from the DOCUMENT destination.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: excludes one or more output objects from the DOCUMENT destination.

arguments.name: SELECT
arguments.description: selects one or more output objects for the DOCUMENT destination.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: selects one or more output objects for the DOCUMENT destination.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: selects one or more output objects for the DOCUMENT destination.

arguments.name: SHOW
arguments.description: writes the current selection or exclusion list for the destination to the SAS log.

name: ODS EPUB
description: Opens, manages, or closes the EPUB destination, which generates EPUB e-books.
help:
ODS EPUB  <(<ID => identifier)> <action> ;
ODS EPUB  <(<ID => identifier)> <options> ;

arguments.name: ANCHOR=
arguments.description: Specify a unique base name for the anchor tag that identifies each output object in the current chapter

arguments.name: anchor-name
arguments.description: is the base name for the anchor tag that identifies each output object in the current body file.

arguments.name: BOX_SIZING=
arguments.description: Specify how to measure the width of cells. Use to override the default value of BOX_SIZING for a destination

arguments.name: CSSSTYLE=
arguments.description: Specify a cascading style sheet to apply to your output

arguments.name: "external-file"
arguments.description: is the name of the external file.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: is a file reference that has been assigned to an external file. Use the FILENAME statement to assign a fileref.

arguments.name: "URL"
arguments.description: is a URL to an external file.

arguments.name: (media-type-1<.. media-type-10>)
arguments.description: specifies one or more media blocks that correspond to the type of media that your output is rendered on. CSS uses media type blocks to specify how a document is to be presented on different media: on the screen, on paper, with a speech synthesizer, with a braille device, and so on.

arguments.name: DEVICE=
arguments.description: Specify the name of a device driver.

arguments.name: DOM
arguments.description: Specify that the ODS document object model is written to the SAS Log or to an external file

arguments.name: external-file
arguments.description: is the name of an external output file.

arguments.name: EVENT=
arguments.description: Specify an event and the value for event variables that are associated with the event
arguments.help: EVENT=(FINISH |                         LABEL=*event-name* | NAME= | START | STYLE= | TARGET= | TEXT= | URL=)

arguments.name: BRANCH=
arguments.description: specifies that an entry for the chapter is to be created in the table of contents for the EPUB book. ODS EPUB does not automatically create table of contents entries for nonlinear output. BRANCH events can be nested to build nested table of contents entries. Match up the START and FINISH options to the desired depth.

arguments.name: FIGURE=
arguments.description: adds figures that are embedded in the e-book book. This block contains a single image. ODS EPUB implements FIGURE as an event.

arguments.name: START
arguments.description: starts the code block that embeds the figure.

arguments.name: FINISH
arguments.description: ends the code block that embeds the figure.

arguments.name: FIGCAPTION=
arguments.description: adds text to the figure. This option provides markup for captioned content that is self-contained and can be separated from the main flow of the document. A figure can contain one caption and it must appear first or last in the caption content. ODS EPUB implements FIGCAPTION as an event. The FIGCAPTION event accepts TEXT, which is the text to be displayed above or below the content.

arguments.name: (FINISH)
arguments.description: triggers the finish section of an event.

arguments.name: IMAGE
arguments.description: specifies a URL for the image.

arguments.name: (LABEL='')
arguments.description: specifies the value for the LABEL event variable.

arguments.name: (NAME='')
arguments.description: specifies the value for the NAME event variable.

arguments.name: (START)
arguments.description: triggers the start of an event.

arguments.name: (STYLE=)
arguments.description: specifies a style element.

arguments.name: (TARGET='')
arguments.description: specifies the value for the TARGET event variable.

arguments.name: (TEXT='')
arguments.description: specifies the value for the TEXT event variable.

arguments.name: (URL='')
arguments.description: specifies the value for the URL event variable.

arguments.name: FILE=
arguments.description: Specify the file that contains the e-book created by the destination

arguments.name: external-file
arguments.description: is the name of an external file to receive output.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: is a file reference that has been assigned to an external file. Use the FILENAME statement to assign a fileref.

arguments.name: GFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: Control the location where footnotes are printed in the graphics output

arguments.name: GFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: prints footnotes that are created by SAS/GRAPH, the SGPLOT procedure, the SGPANEL procedure, or the SGSCATTER procedure. The footnotes appear inside the graph borders.

arguments.name: NOGFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: prints footnotes that are created by ODS, which appear outside the graph borders.

arguments.name: NOGFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: Control the location where footnotes are printed in the graphics output

arguments.name: GFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: prints footnotes that are created by SAS/GRAPH, the SGPLOT procedure, the SGPANEL procedure, or the SGSCATTER procedure. The footnotes appear inside the graph borders.

arguments.name: NOGFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: prints footnotes that are created by ODS, which appear outside the graph borders.

arguments.name: GTITLE
arguments.description: Control the location where titles are printed in the graphics output

arguments.name: GTITLE
arguments.description: prints the title that is created by SAS/GRAPH, the SGPLOT procedure, the SGPANEL procedure, or the SGSCATTER procedure. The title appears inside the graph borders.

arguments.name: NOGTITLE
arguments.description: prints the title that is created by ODS, which appears outside of the graph borders.

arguments.name: NOGTITLE
arguments.description: Control the location where titles are printed in the graphics output

arguments.name: GTITLE
arguments.description: prints the title that is created by SAS/GRAPH, the SGPLOT procedure, the SGPANEL procedure, or the SGSCATTER procedure. The title appears inside the graph borders.

arguments.name: NOGTITLE
arguments.description: prints the title that is created by ODS, which appears outside of the graph borders.

arguments.name: (ID= )
arguments.description: Open multiple instances of the same destination at the same time

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: specifies another instance of the destination that is already open. identifier is numeric or a series of characters that begin with a letter or an underscore. Subsequent characters can include letters, underscores, and numeric characters.

arguments.name: IMAGE_DPI
arguments.description: Specify the image resolution for the graphical output

arguments.name: NEWCHAPTER=
arguments.description: Create a new chapter at the specified starting point

arguments.name: BYGROUP
arguments.description: starts a new chapter for the results of each BY group.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: writes all output to the current chapter.

arguments.name: NOW
arguments.description: starts a new chapter and writes all output to that new chapter.

arguments.name: OUTPUT
arguments.description: starts a new chapter for each output object.

arguments.name: PAGE
arguments.description: starts a new chapter for each page of output. A page break occurs when you start a new procedure, or when a procedure explicitly starts a new page.

arguments.name: PROC
arguments.description: starts a new chapter for each procedure.

arguments.name: OPTIONS
arguments.description: Specify destination-specific suboptions and a space-delimited named value for how e-books are handled

arguments.name: (CHAPTER_TYPE=’’)
arguments.description: Specifies the type of the current chapter. The type is one or more space-delimited terms defined by EPUB 3 Structural Semantics Vocabulary. For more information, see https://idpf.github.io/epub-vocabs/structure/.

arguments.name: (CONTENTS=')
arguments.description: generates a table of contents.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: does not generate a table of contents.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: generates a table of contents.

arguments.name: (CONTRIBUTOR='')
arguments.description: specifies one or more contributor’s names responsible for making contributions to the content of the e-book. Delimit multiple contributors with commas.

arguments.name: (COVER_IMAGE='')
arguments.description: specifies a cover image for the e-book.

arguments.name: (COVERAGE='')
arguments.description: specifies the extent or scope of the content of the e-book.

arguments.name: (CREATOR='')
arguments.description: specifies one or more primary creators or authors of the e-book.

arguments.name: (DEFEAT_Books_CACHING=)
arguments.description: defeats Books e-book reader's caching of e-books that have the same title.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: caches Books of the same title.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: defeats Books caching.

arguments.name: (DESCRIPTION='')
arguments.description: specifies a description of the content of the e-book.

arguments.name: (EMBEDDED_FONTS='')
arguments.description: specifies a list of fonts to be embedded in the e-book.

arguments.name: (HIDE_CONTENTS=)
arguments.description: hides entries in a linear table of contents.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: does not hide the entries in a linear table of contents.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: hides the entries in a linear table of contents.

arguments.name: (HIDE_LANDMARKS=)
arguments.description: hides entries in a linear table of landmarks.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: does not hide the entries in a linear table of landmarks.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: hides the entries in a linear table of landmarks.

arguments.name: (ISBN='')
arguments.description: specifies a 13-digit International Standard Book Number (ISBN) for the e-book. For more information, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number. If not specified, a Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) is generated for the e-book. For more information, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universally_unique_identifier.

arguments.name: (LANDMARK=
arguments.description: specifies the landmark for the current chapter. If 'AUTO' is specified, the landmark will be derived from the chapter type.

arguments.name: (LINEAR_NAV=)
arguments.description: specifies navigational aids to embed in the e-book.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: no navigational aids are embedded in the e-book.

arguments.name: CONTENTS
arguments.description: causes the table of contents to be embedded.

arguments.name: LANDMARKS
arguments.description: causes table of landmarks to be embedded.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: causes the table of contents and the table of landmarks to be embedded.

arguments.name: (NONLINEAR=)
arguments.description: specifies output to be written to the non-linear section of the e-book.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: occurs within the linear flow of the e-book.

arguments.name: CHAPTER
arguments.description: causes the entire chapter to be non-linear.

arguments.name: BATCH
arguments.description: causes batch (preformatted) output to be non-linear.

arguments.name: TABLE
arguments.description: causes tables to be non-linear.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: causes the entire chapter to be non-linear. This has the same effect as the CHAPTER value.

arguments.name: (OPTIMIZE_FOR_IBOOKS=)
arguments.description: optimizes for Books e-book reader.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: overrides user-specified fonts.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: honors user-specified fonts.

arguments.name: (PAGEBREAK=)
arguments.description: honors explicit page breaks.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: does not honor explicit page breaks.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: honors explicit page breaks.

arguments.name: AUTO
arguments.description: allows ODS and procedures to determine when page breaks occur. Honors explicit page breaks.

arguments.name: (PUBLISHER='')
arguments.description: specifies the publisher of the e-book.

arguments.name: (RELATION='')
arguments.description: specifies a reference to a related resource.

arguments.name: (RIGHTS='')
arguments.description: specifies information about rights held in and over the e-book.

arguments.name: (SOURCE='')
arguments.description: specifies information about a prior resource from which the e-book was derived.

arguments.name: (START='')
arguments.description: specifies the component (chapter) at which an e-book first opens.

arguments.name: (SUBJECT='')
arguments.description: specifies one or more topics about the content of the e-book. Delimit multiple subjects with commas.

arguments.name: TOC_LEVEL=
arguments.description: Control the depth of the table of contents in the document

arguments.name: TOC_TYPE=
arguments.description: Specify whether the ODS EPUB destination generates the legacy table of contents automatically, or the user generates a custom table of contents manually using nested headings

arguments.name: (TYPE='')
arguments.description: specifies the nature or genre of the content of the e-book.

arguments.name: STYLE=
arguments.description: Specifies one or more style-overrides to use when writing output files

arguments.name: STYLESHEET=
arguments.description: Specify one or more style sheet files to apply to the output

arguments.name: (URL= )
arguments.description: specifies one or more space-delimited external style sheet filenames.

arguments.name: TITLE=
arguments.description: Insert the text string of a title that you specify into the metadata of the e-book

arguments.name: WORK=
arguments.description: Specify a work directory for constructing the e-book

arguments.name: directory-name
arguments.description: is the name of the directory.

arguments.name: CLOSE
arguments.description: Close the destination and the file that is associated with it.

arguments.name: EXCLUDE
arguments.description: Exclude output objects from the destination

arguments.name: SELECT
arguments.description: Select output objects for the destination.

arguments.name: SHOW
arguments.description: Write to the SAS Log the current selection or exclusion list for the destination

name: ODS ESCAPECHAR
description: Defines a representative character to be used in output strings.

arguments.name: escape-character
arguments.description: specifies the special character that identifies the inline formatting symbol. The escape-character should be one of the following rarely used characters: @, ^, or \.

name: ODS EXCEL
description: Opens, manages, or closes the ODS destination for Excel, which produces Excel spreadsheet files compatible with Microsoft Office 2010 and later versions.
help:
ODS EXCEL  <(<ID => identifier)> <action> ;
ODS EXCEL  <(<ID => identifier)> <options> ;

arguments.name: ANCHOR=
arguments.description: Specify the root name for the anchor tag that identifies each output object in the current file

arguments.name: anchor-name
arguments.description: is the root name for the anchor tag that identifies each output object in the current file. Each output object must have an anchor tag for the bookmarks to reference. The references are automatically created by ODS. These references point to the name of an anchor. Therefore, each anchor name in a file must be unique. By default IDX is the default name for the first object.

arguments.name: AUTHOR=
arguments.description: Specify the author of the Excel document

arguments.name: BOX_SIZING=
arguments.description: Specify how to measure the width of cells. Use to override the default value of BOX_SIZING for a destination

arguments.name: CATEGORY=
arguments.description: Specify the category of the Excel document

arguments.name: COMMENTS=
arguments.description: Add comments to the properties of the Excel document

arguments.name: CSSSTYLE=
arguments.description: Specify a cascading style sheet to apply to your output

arguments.name: 'external-file'
arguments.description: is the name of the external file.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: is a file reference that has been assigned to an external file. Use the FILENAME statement to assign a fileref.

arguments.name: 'URL'
arguments.description: is a URL to an external file.

arguments.name: (media-type-1<.. media-type-10>)
arguments.description: specifies one or more media blocks that correspond to the type of media that your output is rendered on. CSS uses media type blocks to specify how a document is to be presented on different media: on the screen, on paper, with a speech synthesizer, with a braille device, and so on.

arguments.name: DOM
arguments.description: Specify that the ODS document object model is written to the SAS Log or to an external file

arguments.name: external-file
arguments.description: is the name of an external output file.

arguments.name: FILE=
arguments.description: Specify the file that contains the Excel created by the destination

arguments.name: external-file
arguments.description: is the name of an external file to receive output.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: is a file reference that has been assigned to an external file. Use the FILENAME statement to assign a fileref.

arguments.name: GFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: Control the location where footnotes are printed in the graphics output

arguments.name: GFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: prints footnotes that are created by SAS/GRAPH, the SGPLOT procedure, the SGPANEL procedure, or the SGSCATTER procedure. The footnotes appear inside the graph borders.

arguments.name: NOGFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: prints footnotes that are created by ODS, which appear outside the graph borders.

arguments.name: NOGFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: Control the location where footnotes are printed in the graphics output

arguments.name: GFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: prints footnotes that are created by SAS/GRAPH, the SGPLOT procedure, the SGPANEL procedure, or the SGSCATTER procedure. The footnotes appear inside the graph borders.

arguments.name: NOGFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: prints footnotes that are created by ODS, which appear outside the graph borders.

arguments.name: GTITLE
arguments.description: Control the location where titles are printed in the graphics output

arguments.name: GTITLE
arguments.description: prints the title that is created by SAS/GRAPH, the SGPLOT procedure, the SGPANEL procedure, or the SGSCATTER procedure. The title appears inside the graph borders.

arguments.name: NOGTITLE
arguments.description: prints the title that is created by ODS, which appears outside of the graph borders.

arguments.name: NOGTITLE
arguments.description: Control the location where titles are printed in the graphics output

arguments.name: GTITLE
arguments.description: prints the title that is created by SAS/GRAPH, the SGPLOT procedure, the SGPANEL procedure, or the SGSCATTER procedure. The title appears inside the graph borders.

arguments.name: NOGTITLE
arguments.description: prints the title that is created by ODS, which appears outside of the graph borders.

arguments.name: IMAGE_DPI=
arguments.description: Specify the image resolution for the graphical output

arguments.name: KEYWORDS=
arguments.description: Add keywords to the Excel document properties

arguments.name: (ID= )
arguments.description: Open multiple instances of the same destination at the same time

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: specifies another instance of the destination that is already open. identifier is numeric or a series of characters that begin with a letter or an underscore. Subsequent characters can include letters, underscores, and numeric characters.

arguments.name: OPTIONS
arguments.description: Specify destination-specific suboptions

arguments.name: (ABSOLUTE_COLUMN_WIDTH ='')
arguments.description: specifies the column widths. Lists widths to use for columns instead of allowing SAS to determine the column width (measured widths). The number-list is a comma separated list of numbers. A value of 0 resets the default.

arguments.name: (ABSOLUTE_ROW_HEIGHT ='')
arguments.description: specifies the table body row heights. Specifying one number applies the same height value to all table body rows. A list of numbers applies a custom height to each row sequentially starting from the top of the spreadsheet. This option overrides SAS determining the column height (measured height). The number-list is a comma-separated list of numbers.

arguments.name: (AUTOFILTER =
arguments.description: turns on filtering for specified columns in the worksheet.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: an autofilter is applied to all columns.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: no autofiltering is applied.

arguments.name: range
arguments.description: specifies the range of columns to which filtering is applied. Acceptable values for the range are a numeric range (‘3-5’) or a column range (‘A:C’).

arguments.name: column
arguments.description: specifies the column to which filtering is applied. Columns can be written as a number or a letter.

arguments.name: (BLACKANDWHITE=)
arguments.description: enables printing of the worksheet in black and white.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: prints the worksheet in black and white.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: does not print the worksheet in black and white.

arguments.name: (BLANK_SHEET='')
arguments.description: creates a blank worksheet with the specified name. The string is a string with a length greater than zero. This name is used in combination with a worksheet counter to create a unique name.

arguments.name: (BLANK_TAB_COLOR=)
arguments.description: specifies the tab color of a blank worksheet.

arguments.name: 'string'
arguments.description: specifies the tab color for the blank worksheet.

arguments.name: 'NONE'
arguments.description: specifies that no tab color is applied to the blank worksheet.

arguments.name: (CENTER_HORIZONTAL=)
arguments.description: centers the worksheet horizontally when printing.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: centers the worksheet horizontally when printing.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: does not center the worksheet horizontally when printing.

arguments.name: (CENTER_VERTICAL=)
arguments.description: specifies if the worksheet is to be centered vertically when printing.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: centers the worksheet vertically when printing.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: does not center the worksheet vertically when printing.

arguments.name: (COLUMN_REPEAT=)
arguments.description: controls how column headings are repeated across pages.

arguments.name: HEADER
arguments.description: repeat any of the columns containing headers.

arguments.name: column
arguments.description: specifies that the header of the column specified is repeated on each page. A column can be a number or a letter.

arguments.name: range
arguments.description: specifies that the headers of the columns within the range specified are repeated on each page. A range can be numbers ('1-3') or columns ('A:C').

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: specifies that there are no repeating columns.

arguments.name: (CONTENTS=)
arguments.description: creates a worksheet that contains the table of contents.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: creates a worksheet that contains the table of contents.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: creates a worksheet that does not contain a table of contents.

arguments.name: (DPI='')
arguments.description: specifies the dots per inch for print resolution. Numbers allowed are 300, 600, and 1200.

arguments.name: (DRAFTQUALITY=)
arguments.description: specifies if draft quality should be used for printing

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: specifies that draft quality should be used for printing.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: specifies that draft quality should not be used for printing.

arguments.name: (EMBEDDED_FOOTNOTES=)
arguments.description: specifies whether footnotes should appear in the worksheet.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: embed footnotes in the worksheet.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: do not embed footnotes in the worksheet.

arguments.name: (EMBED_FOOTNOTES_ONCE=)
arguments.description: specifies whether embedded footnotes should appear only at the bottom of the worksheet.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: embedded footnotes appear only once at the bottom of the worksheet.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: embedded footnotes appear at the bottom of the worksheet.

arguments.name: (EMBEDDED_TITLES=)
arguments.description: specifies whether titles should appear in the worksheet.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: embed titles in the worksheet.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: do not embed titles in the worksheet.

arguments.name: (EMBED_TITLES_ONCE=)
arguments.description: specifies whether embedded titles should appear at the top of the worksheet only once.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: embedded titles appear only once at the top of the worksheet.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: titles appear as they normally appear.

arguments.name: (FITTOPAGE=)
arguments.description: specifies that the worksheet should fit on a page when printing.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: fits the worksheet on the page when printing.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: does not try to fit the worksheet on the page when printing.

arguments.name: (FLOW=)
arguments.description: specifies that a designated Worksheet area enables Wrap Text and disables newline character insertion. Excel wraps the text to the column width.

arguments.name: cell-names
arguments.description: enables Wrap Text for a single cell such as “A12” or a cell range such as “C1:E4”.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: enables Wrap Text for table data cells.

arguments.name: HEADERS
arguments.description: enables Wrap Text in table column headers.

arguments.name: ROWHEADERS
arguments.description: enables Wrap Text for table row headers.

arguments.name: TABLES
arguments.description: enables Wrap Text for all parts of a table: HEADER, ROWHEADER, and DATA.

arguments.name: TEXT
arguments.description: makes ODS TEXT output work like titles, footnotes, PROC titles, and BY lines. The text is written into multiple merged cells and Wrap Text is enabled.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: specifies that text wrapping is not enabled. This option can turn off the FLOW= option.

arguments.name: (FORMULAS=)
arguments.description: specifies if data values that begin with an '=' become formulas or cell values.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: data values that begin with an '=' become formulas.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: data values that begin with an '=' become cell values.

arguments.name: (FROZEN_HEADERS=
arguments.description: specifies that headers can scroll or not scroll with the scroll bar.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: headers do not scroll with the scroll bar.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: headers do scroll with the scroll bar.

arguments.name: number
arguments.description: the number of the header row that does not scroll with the scroll bar.

arguments.name: (FROZEN_ROWHEADERS=
arguments.description: specifies if the row headers are on the left scroll when the table data scrolls.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: the row headers on the left are frozen when the table data scrolls.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: the row headers on the left scroll when the table data scrolls.

arguments.name: number
arguments.description: freeze the number of columns specified.

arguments.name: (GRIDLINES=)
arguments.description: specifies if grid lines are printed.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: grid lines are printed.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: grid lines are not printed.

arguments.name: (HIDDEN_COLUMNS =
arguments.description: specifies the columns to hide.

arguments.name: number-list
arguments.description: specifies a comma-delimited list of column numbers

arguments.name: column
arguments.description: specifies the number or letter of a column

arguments.name: range
arguments.description: specifies a cell range. Cell ranges can be written as numbers ('1-3') or letters ('A:C').

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: specifies that all columns are shown.

arguments.name: (HIDDEN_ROWS =)
arguments.description: specifies the rows to hide. You can specify a list of rows to hide or a range of rows to hide.

arguments.name: 'number_list_range'
arguments.description: specifies a list of rows or a range of rows to hide.

arguments.name: 'NONE'
arguments.description: specifies that all rows are shown.

arguments.name: (INDEX=)
arguments.description: creates a worksheet that contains an index of all worksheets.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: creates a worksheet that contains an index of all worksheets.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: does not create a worksheet that contains an index of all worksheets.

arguments.name: (MSG_LEVEL=)
arguments.description: suppresses messages from Excel.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: suppresses messages

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: leaves messages

arguments.name: (ORIENTATION=
arguments.description: orients the printed page as either portrait or landscape.

arguments.name: PORTRAIT
arguments.description: prints a portrait-oriented page.

arguments.name: LANDSCAPE
arguments.description: prints a landscape-oriented page.

arguments.name: (PAGE_ORDER_ACROSS=)
arguments.description: specifies that the information across the page is printed first followed by the information that is down the page.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: print all of the information across the page first, followed by the information down the page.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: print all of the information down the page first, followed by the information across the page.

arguments.name: (PAGES_FITHEIGHT='')
arguments.description: specifies the number of pages down to fit the worksheet when printing.

arguments.name: (PAGES_FITWIDTH='')
arguments.description: specifies the number of pages to fit the worksheet across when printing.

arguments.name: (PRINT_AREA= '')
arguments.description: describes the printed area in terms of the column and row to start and end with. You can use column and row numbers and letters delimited by commas, or you can use a cell range. The following example indicates top left corner and bottom right corner:

arguments.name: (PRINT_FOOTER=)
arguments.description: specifies the text that is placed in the footer when printing. If a footnote is specified, that footnote is used. Otherwise, this text is placed in the footer.

arguments.name: 'text-string'
arguments.description: specifies the text that is placed in the footer when printing.

arguments.name: 'NONE'
arguments.description: specifies that no text is printed in the footer.

arguments.name: (PRINT_FOOTER_MARGIN='')
arguments.description: specifies the footer margin that is set in the page setup window when printing. This margin is measured in inches.

arguments.name: (PRINT_HEADER=)
arguments.description: specifies the text that is placed in the header when printing. If no title is specified, this text is used by Excel on the printed page. If a title has been specified with the TITLE statement, that title is used.

arguments.name: 'text-string'
arguments.description: specifies the text that is placed in the header when printing.

arguments.name: 'NONE'
arguments.description: specifies that no text is printed in the header.

arguments.name: (PRINT_HEADER_MARGIN='')
arguments.description: specifies the header margin that is set in the page setup dialog window when printing. This margin is measured in inches.

arguments.name: (PROTECT_WORKSHEET=)
arguments.description: protects the worksheet by making it read-only.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: read-only access protects the worksheet.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: does not protect the worksheet with read-only access.

arguments.name: (ROWBREAKS_COUNT='')
arguments.description: specifies that for every number data rows, insert a print page for printing.

arguments.name: (ROWBREAKS_INTERVAL=')
arguments.description: controls the placement of page breaks. This option places a page break after each output object or after each procedure.

arguments.name: OUTPUT
arguments.description: inserts a page break between output objects.

arguments.name: PROC
arguments.description: inserts a page break between each procedure's output.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: does not insert custom page breaks.

arguments.name: (ROWCOLHEADINGS=)
arguments.description: specifies if row and column headings should be printed.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: prints row and column headings.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: does not print row and column headings.

arguments.name: (ROW_HEIGHTS ='')
arguments.description: specifies the height of the row.

arguments.name: (ROW_REPEAT=
arguments.description: controls how row headings are repeated across pages. For example, row_repeat='header' repeats all the row headers, row_repeat='1' repeats only one row, and row_repeat='1-3' repeats rows 1, 2, and 3.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: specifies that no rows are repeated on each page.

arguments.name: HEADER
arguments.description: specifies that all row headings are repeated on each page.

arguments.name: number
arguments.description: specifies that the header of the row specified is repeated on each page.

arguments.name: number-range
arguments.description: specifies that the headers of the rows within the range specified are repeated on each page.

arguments.name: (SCALE='')
arguments.description: specifies the scale level for printing.

arguments.name: (SCREEN_RESOLUTION_SCALE_FACTOR= )
arguments.description: specifies the scale factor to optimize viewing of Excel spreadsheets on high-resolution displays.

arguments.name: 'display-scale-factor'
arguments.description: specifies the scale factor.

arguments.name: 'NONE'
arguments.description: specifies that no scale factor is used.

arguments.name: (SHEET_INTERVAL=
arguments.description: specifies the criteria for when a new worksheet is created.

arguments.name: BYGROUP
arguments.description: creates a new worksheet after each BYGROUP.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: creates one worksheet with all of the data.

arguments.name: NOW
arguments.description: creates a new worksheet. When used, the next output object starts on a new sheet. After SHEET_INTERVAL='NOW' is executed, the SHEET_INTERVAL option reverts to the previous setting.

arguments.name: PAGE
arguments.description: creates a worksheet for each page of procedure output.

arguments.name: PROC
arguments.description: creates a worksheet of all of the procedure output.

arguments.name: TABLE
arguments.description: creates a worksheet for each table.

arguments.name: (SHEET_LABEL=)
arguments.description: used as the first part of the name in the worksheet label instead of the predefined string. This option is used in combination with the various worksheet naming options like SHEET_INTERVAL.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: creates worksheet labels named by default.

arguments.name: text-string
arguments.description: names the first part of the label of a worksheet with the specified string.

arguments.name: (SHEET_NAME=)
arguments.description: specifies the name for the next worksheet. This name is used along with the worksheet counter to create a unique name.

arguments.name: 'text-string'
arguments.description: specifies the name for the next worksheet.

arguments.name: 'NONE'
arguments.description: creates worksheets named by default.

arguments.name: (START_AT=)
arguments.description: specifies a starting cell for the report. The default is to start at column 1 and row 1 (A1).

arguments.name: 'string'
arguments.description: specifies a starting cell for the report.

arguments.name: 'NONE'
arguments.description: specifies that the report starts at column 1 and row 1 (A1).

arguments.name: (SUPPRESS_BYLINES=)
arguments.description: specifies whether to suppress BY lines in the worksheet.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: suppress BY lines in the worksheet.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: BY lines appear in the worksheet.

arguments.name: (TAB_COLOR=)
arguments.description: specifies the color for the next worksheet.

arguments.name: 'string'
arguments.description: specifies the color for the next worksheet.

arguments.name: 'NONE'
arguments.description: specifies that no color is applied to the next worksheet.

arguments.name: (TITLE_FOOTNOTE_NOBREAK=)
arguments.description: specifies whether procedure titles, titles, BY lines, and footnotes wrap across lines.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: specifies that procedure titles, titles, BY lines, and footnotes wrap across lines.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: specifies that procedure titles, titles, BY lines, and footnotes do not wrap across lines.

arguments.name: (TITLE_FOOTNOTE_WIDTH='')
arguments.description: specifies the number of columns that titles and footnotes should span. If zero, titles and footnotes are merged across the number of columns currently in use.

arguments.name: (ZOOM='')
arguments.description: indicates the initial zoom level on the worksheet.

arguments.name: STATUS=
arguments.description: Insert the status of the Excel document

arguments.name: STYLE=
arguments.description: Specify one or more style-overides to use when writing output files

arguments.name: TEXT=
arguments.description: Insert text into your document

arguments.name: TITLE=
arguments.description: Specify a title for the Excel document

arguments.name: WORK=
arguments.description: Specify an alternate directory for the temporary files

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: is a file reference that has been assigned to a directory. Use the FILENAME statement to assign a fileref.

arguments.name: directory-name
arguments.description: is the name of the directory.

arguments.name: CLOSE
arguments.description: Close the destination and the file that is associated with it.

arguments.name: EXCLUDE
arguments.description: Exclude output objects from the destination

arguments.name: SELECT
arguments.description: Select output objects for the destination.

arguments.name: SHOW
arguments.description: Write to the SAS Log the current selection or exclusion list for the destination

arguments.name: SUBJECT=
arguments.description: Insert the text string that you specify as the subject in the metadata of a file

arguments.name: subject-text
arguments.description: specifies the text in the metadata of a file that indicates the subject.

name: ODS EXCLUDE
description: Specifies output objects to exclude from ODS destinations.

arguments.name: output-object
arguments.description:
specifies one or more output objects to exclude. To specify an output object, you need to know which output objects your SAS program produces. The ODS TRACE statement writes to the SAS log a trace record that includes the path, the label, and other information about each output object that is produced. You can specify an output object in any of the following ways:
• a full path. For example, the following is the full path of the output object:  
• a partial path. A partial path consists of any part of the full path that begins immediately after a period (.) and continues to the end of the full path. For example, suppose the full path is the following:   
• a label that is enclosed in quotation marks.
• a label path. For example, the following is the label path for  the output object: 
• a partial label path. A partial label path consists of any part of the label that begins immediately after a period (.) and continues to the end of the label. For example, suppose the label path is the following: 
• a mixture of labels and paths.
• any of the partial path specifications, followed by a number sign (#) and a number. For example,  refers to the third output object that is named .

arguments.name: (PERSIST)
arguments.description: keeps the output-object that precedes the PERSIST option in the exclusion list until you explicitly modify the list.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: specifies that ODS does not send any output objects to the open destination.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: specifies that ODS send all of the output objects to the open destination.

arguments.name: NOWARN
arguments.description: suppresses the warning that an output object was requested but not created.

arguments.name: ODS-destination
arguments.description: specifies to which ODS destination's exclusion list to write, where ODS-destination can be any valid ODS destination. For a discussion of ODS destinations, see .

arguments.name: WHERE=
arguments.description: excludes output objects that meet a particular condition. For example, the following statement excludes only output objects with the word "Histogram" in their name:

arguments.name: _LABEL_
arguments.description: is the label of the output object.

arguments.name: _LABELPATH_
arguments.description: is the label path of the output object.

arguments.name: _NAME_
arguments.description: is the name of the output object.

arguments.name: _PATH_
arguments.description: is the name path of the output object.

arguments.name: operator
arguments.description: compares a variable with a value or with another variable. operator can be AND, OR NOT, OR, AND NOT, or a comparison operator.

name: ODS GRAPHICS
description: Enables or disables ODS Graphics processing and sets graphics environment options. This statement affects ODS template-based (ODS Graphics) graphics only. The ODS GRAPHICS statement does not affect device-based graphics (SAS/GRAPH).

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: enables ODS Graphics processing.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: disables ODS Graphics processing.

arguments.name: ANTIALIAS
arguments.description: smooths jagged edges of all components in the graph.

arguments.name: ANTIALIAS=
arguments.description: specifies whether anti-aliasing is applied to the rendering of the line and markers in any graph.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: smooths jagged edges of all components in the graph.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: does not smooth jagged edges of components other than text in the graph.

arguments.name: ANTIALIASMAX=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of graphics elements before anti-aliasing is disabled.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies a positive integer.

arguments.name: ATTRPRIORITY=
arguments.description: specifies a priority for cycling of the group attributes.

arguments.name: COLOR
arguments.description: assigns priority to the color attribute rotation by cycling through the list of colors while holding the marker symbol and line pattern constant. When all of the colors are exhausted, the marker symbol and line style attributes increment to the next element, and then the colors in the list are repeated. This pattern repeats as needed.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: does not use an attribute priority in the rotation pattern, even if one is set in the active style’s AttrPriority attribute. The rotation pattern cycles progressively through the attribute lists.

arguments.name: BORDER
arguments.description: draws a border around the graph.

arguments.name: BORDER=
arguments.description: specifies whether to draw a border around each graph.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: draws a border around the graph.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: does not draw a border around the graph.

arguments.name: BYLINE=
arguments.description: specifies how the BY line is displayed in graphs.

arguments.name: NOBYLINE
arguments.description: specifies that no BY line is displayed. NOBYLINE is the default.

arguments.name: FOOTNOTE
arguments.description: specifies that the BY line is displayed as a left-justified graph footnote. This is the recommended setting.

arguments.name: TITLE
arguments.description: specifies that the BY line is displayed as a centered graph title. Specifying TITLE is not recommended because graphs are not designed to have additional title lines.

arguments.name: DATASKINMAX=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of graphical elements allowed per plot when a data skin is applied.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies a positive integer.

arguments.name: DISCRETEMAX=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of discrete values to be shown in any graph.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies a positive integer.

arguments.name: DRILLTARGET=
arguments.description: specifies the window that displays the drill-down output.

arguments.name: "_blank"
arguments.description: opens a new browser window to display the drilldown output.

arguments.name: "_self"
arguments.description: opens the drill-down output in the same window.

arguments.name: "_parent"
arguments.description: opens the drill-down output in the parent frame.

arguments.name: "_top"
arguments.description: opens the drill-down output in the full body of the window.

arguments.name: "frame-name"
arguments.description: opens the drill down output in the named frame in the current window. If the name does not exist, the output is opened in a new window.

arguments.name: GROUPMAX=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of group values to be shown in any graph.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies a positive integer.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: specifies the height of a graph.

arguments.name: dimension
arguments.description: is a nonnegative number followed by one of these units of measure:

arguments.name: IMAGEMAP
arguments.description: specifies to generate data tips.

arguments.name: IMAGEMAP=
arguments.description: specifies whether data tips are generated.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: specifies to generate data tips.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: specifies not to generate data tips.

arguments.name: IMAGENAME=
arguments.description: specifies the base image file name.

arguments.name: LABELMAX=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of labeled areas before data label collision avoidance is disabled.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies a positive integer.

arguments.name: LABELPLACEMENT=
arguments.description: specifies the label-placement algorithm to use for positioning labels in the graphs.

arguments.name: GREEDY
arguments.description: specifies the Greedy method for managing label collision. The Greedy method tries different placement combinations in order to find an optimal approximation that avoids collisions. Label placement using this method is often less optimal than label placement using the Simulated Annealing (SA) method. However, depending on the number of data points and the potential for label collisions, the Greedy process can be significantly faster.

arguments.name: SA
arguments.description: specifies the Simulated Annealing method for managing label collision. The SA method attempts to determine the global minimization-of-cost function, which is based on a simulated annealing algorithm. The resulting label placement is usually better than placement using the Greedy method. However, depending on the number of data points and the potential for label collisions, the SA method can be significantly slower.

arguments.name: LEGENDAREAMAX=
arguments.description: specifies an integer that is interpreted as the maximum percentage of the overall graphics area that a legend can occupy.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies a positive integer.

arguments.name: LINEPATTERNOBSMAX=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum the number of vertices for a patterned line.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies a positive integer.

arguments.name: LOESSOBSMAX=
arguments.description: specifies an upper limit for the number of observations that can be used with a loess plot.

arguments.name: NBINSMAX=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of bins that are processed for histograms.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies a positive integer.

arguments.name: NOANTIALIAS
arguments.description: does not smooth jagged edges of components other than text in the graph.

arguments.name: NOBORDER
arguments.description: does not draw a border around the graph.

arguments.name: NOIMAGEMAP
arguments.description: specifies not to generate data tips.

arguments.name: NOSCALE
arguments.description: does not scale the components of a graph proportionally.

arguments.name: NOSCALEMARKERS
arguments.description: does not scale the markers with the graph size.

arguments.name: NOSUBPIXEL
arguments.description: never uses subpixel rendering.

arguments.name: NXYBINSMAX=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of bins that are processed for heat maps.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies a positive integer.

arguments.name: OBSMAX=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of observations that are processed.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies a positive integer.

arguments.name: OUTPUTFMT=
arguments.description: specifies the output format used to generate image or vector graphic files.

arguments.name: file-type
arguments.description: is the image or vector graphic format to be generated. See .

arguments.name: STATIC
arguments.description: uses the best quality static image format for the active output destination. This is the default output format.

arguments.name: PANELCELLMAX=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of cells in a graph panel where the number of cells is determined dynamically by classification variables.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies a positive integer.

arguments.name: POP
arguments.description: restores the most recently pushed settings from the stack.

arguments.name: PUSH
arguments.description: pushes the current ODS GRAPHICS settings to a stack.

arguments.name: RESET
arguments.description: resets all options to their defaults.

arguments.name: RESET=
arguments.description: resets one or all of the ODS GRAPHICS options to their defaults.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: resets all of the ODS GRAPHICS options to their defaults.

arguments.name: option
arguments.description: specifies the name of an option to reset.

arguments.name: SCALE
arguments.description: scales the components of a graph proportionally.

arguments.name: SCALE=
arguments.description: specifies whether the content of a graph is scaled proportionally.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: scales the components of a graph proportionally.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: does not scale the components of a graph proportionally.

arguments.name: SCALEMARKERS
arguments.description: scales the markers with the graph size.

arguments.name: SCALEMARKERS=
arguments.description: specifies whether the plot markers are to be scaled with the graph size.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: scales the markers with the graph size.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: does not scale the markers with the graph size.

arguments.name: SHOW
arguments.description: writes the current ODS Graphics settings to the SAS log.

arguments.name: STACKDEPTHMAX=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum stack depth for PUSH and POP requests.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies a positive integer.

arguments.name: SUBPIXEL
arguments.description: always uses subpixel rendering, when applicable, for rendering lines and bars.

arguments.name: SUBPIXEL=
arguments.description: specifies whether subpixel rendering should be used for rendering ODS Graphics.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: always uses subpixel rendering, when applicable, for rendering lines and bars.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: never uses subpixel rendering.

arguments.name: TIPMAX=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of distinct data tip areas allowed before data tips are disabled.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies a positive integer.

arguments.name: TOTALCELLMAX=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of total cells in a graph where the number of cells is determined dynamically by classification variables.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies a positive integer.

arguments.name: WIDTH=
arguments.description: specifies the width of any graph.

arguments.name: dimension
arguments.description: is a nonnegative number followed by one of these units of measure:

name: ODS HTML5
description: Opens, manages, or closes the HTML5 destination, which produces HTML 5.0 output that contains embedded style sheets.
help:
ODS HTML5  <(<ID => identifier)> <action> ;
ODS HTML5  <(<ID => identifier)> <options> ;

arguments.name: ANCHOR=
arguments.description: Specify a unique base name for the anchor tag that identifies each output object in the current body file

arguments.name: anchor-name
arguments.description: is the base name for the anchor tag that identifies each output object in the current body file.

arguments.name: ACCESSIBLE_GRAPH
arguments.description: Add accessibility metadata to graphs that are created by ODS Graphics

arguments.name: NOACCESSIBLE_GRAPH
arguments.description: Add accessibility metadata to graphs that are created by ODS Graphics

arguments.name: BASE=
arguments.description: Specify text to use as the first part of all links and references that ODS creates in output files

arguments.name: base-text
arguments.description: is the text that ODS uses as the first part of all links and references that ODS creates in the file. Consider this specification:

arguments.name: BODY=
arguments.description: Open a markup family destination and specify the file that contains the primary output that is created by the ODS statement

arguments.name: external-file

arguments.name: entry.markup

arguments.name: (NO_TOP_MATTER)

arguments.name: (TITLE='')

arguments.name: (URL= '' )

arguments.name: BOX_SIZING=

arguments.name: CHARSET=

arguments.name: GFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: Control the location where footnotes are printed in the graphics output

arguments.name: GFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: writes footnotes that are created by SAS/GRAPH, the SGPLOT procedure, the SGPANEL procedure, the SGPIE procedure, the SGMAP procedure, or the SGSCATTER procedure. The footnotes appear inside the graph borders.

arguments.name: NOGFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: writes footnotes that are created by ODS, which appear outside the graph borders.

arguments.name: NOGFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: Control the location where footnotes are printed in the graphics output

arguments.name: GFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: writes footnotes that are created by SAS/GRAPH, the SGPLOT procedure, the SGPANEL procedure, the SGPIE procedure, the SGMAP procedure, or the SGSCATTER procedure. The footnotes appear inside the graph borders.

arguments.name: NOGFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: writes footnotes that are created by ODS, which appear outside the graph borders.

arguments.name: GPATH=
arguments.description: Specify the location for all graphics output that is generated while the destination is open

arguments.name: 'aggregate-file-storage-location'
arguments.description: specifies an aggregate storage location such as directory, folder, or partitioned data set.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: is a file reference that has been assigned to an aggregate storage location. Use the FILENAME statement to assign a fileref.

arguments.name: libref.catalog
arguments.description: specifies a SAS catalog to write to.

arguments.name: URL=
arguments.description: specifies a URL for file-specification.

arguments.name: Uniform-Resource-Locator
arguments.description: is the URL that you specify. ODS uses this URL instead of the filename in all the links and references that it creates to the file.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: specifies that no information from the GPATH= option appears in the links or references.

arguments.name: GTITLE
arguments.description: Control the location where titles are printed in the graphics output

arguments.name: GTITLE
arguments.description: writes the title that is created by SAS/GRAPH, the SGPLOT procedure, the SGPANEL procedure, or the SGSCATTER procedure. The title appears inside the graph borders.

arguments.name: NOGTITLE
arguments.description: writes the title that is created by ODS, which appears outside of the graph borders.

arguments.name: NOGTITLE
arguments.description: Control the location where titles are printed in the graphics output

arguments.name: GTITLE
arguments.description: writes the title that is created by SAS/GRAPH, the SGPLOT procedure, the SGPANEL procedure, or the SGSCATTER procedure. The title appears inside the graph borders.

arguments.name: NOGTITLE
arguments.description: writes the title that is created by ODS, which appears outside of the graph borders.

arguments.name: HEADTEXT=
arguments.description: Specify HTML tags to place between the < HEAD> and < /HEAD> tags in all of the output files.

arguments.name: markup-document-head
arguments.description: specifies the markup tags to place between the < HEAD> and < /HEAD> tags.

arguments.name: (ID= )
arguments.description: Open multiple instances of the same destination at the same time

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: specifies another instance of the destination that is already open. identifier is numeric or a series of characters that begin with a letter or an underscore. Subsequent characters can include letters, underscores, and numeric characters.

arguments.name: IMAGE_DPI=
arguments.description: Specify the image resolution for graphical output

arguments.name: METATEXT=
arguments.description: Specify HTML code to use as the <META> tag between the <HEAD> and </HEAD> tags in all of the HTML output files.

arguments.name: 'metatext-for-document-head'
arguments.description: specifies the HTML code that provides the browser with information about the document that it is loading. For example, this attribute could specify the content type and the character set to use.

arguments.name: NEWFILE=
arguments.description: Create a new body file at the specified starting point

arguments.name: BYGROUP
arguments.description: starts a new file for the results of each BY group.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: writes all output to the body file that is currently open.

arguments.name: OUTPUT
arguments.description: starts a new body file for each output object. For SAS/GRAPH this means that ODS creates a new file for each SAS/GRAPH output file that the program generates.

arguments.name: PAGE
arguments.description: starts a new body file for each page of output. A page break occurs when a procedure explicitly starts a new page (not because the page size was exceeded) or when you start a new procedure.

arguments.name: PROC
arguments.description: starts a new body file each time you start a new procedure.

arguments.name: OPTIONS
arguments.description: Specify suboptions and a named value for how images are handled using the HTML5 destination
arguments.help: OPTIONS (                      BITMAP_MODE=SVG_MODE= | GRAPH_BITMAP_MODE= | STYLE_BITMAP_MODE= | GRAPH_SVG_MODE= | STYLE_SVG_MODE | SHOW_GRAPH_STYLES= | RESET)

arguments.name: BITMAP_MODE=
arguments.description: specifies how all bit mapped images are inserted into the HTML5 document. These values must be enclosed in parentheses.

arguments.name: EMBED
arguments.description: creates an HTML5 <embed> tag.

arguments.name: IMG
arguments.description: creates an HTML5 tag that displays the image file.

arguments.name: INLINE
arguments.description: inserts the image data into the HTML5 file. The image data is base64 encoded and is inserted into the document as a URL for bitmaps.

arguments.name: LINK
arguments.description: creates a hyperlink that points to the image file.

arguments.name: OBJECT
arguments.description: creates an HTML5 <object> tag that displays the image file. This tag is used to embed multimedia files and applications into your document (audio, video, Java applets, ActiveX, PDF, and Flash).

arguments.name: SVG_MODE=
arguments.description: specifies how all SVG images are inserted into the HTML5 document. These values must be enclosed in parentheses.

arguments.name: EMBED
arguments.description: creates an HTML5 <embed> tag.

arguments.name: IMG
arguments.description: creates an HTML5 tag that displays the image file.

arguments.name: INLINE
arguments.description: inserts the image data into the HTML5 file. The image data is base64 encoded and is inserted into the document as a URL for bitmaps.

arguments.name: LINK
arguments.description: creates a hyperlink that points to the image file.

arguments.name: OBJECT
arguments.description: creates an HTML5 <object> tag that displays the image file. This tag is used to embed multimedia files and applications into your document (audio, video, Java applets, ActiveX, PDF, and Flash).

arguments.name: SHOW_GRAPH_STYLES=
arguments.description: specifies that the output should contain elements from the graph style that is specified for CSS. These values must be enclosed in parentheses.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: specifies that the output should contain elements from the graph style that is specified for CSS.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: specifies that the output should not contain elements from the graph style that is specified for CSS.

arguments.name: USE_CSS_RESET=
arguments.description: turns on or off the default CSS styles information. This option works well with the SHOW_GRAPH_STYLES= suboption to provide a starting point to creating a style that works with the CSSSTYLE= option.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: turns off the default CSS styles information.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: turns on the default CSS styles information.

arguments.name: PACKAGE
arguments.description: Specify that the output from the destination be added to an ODS package

arguments.name: package-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of a package that was created with the ODS PACKAGE statement. If no name is specified, then the output is added to the unnamed package that was opened last.

arguments.name: PAGE=
arguments.description: Open the HTML destination and specify the file that contains a description of each page of the body file and contains links to the body file

arguments.name: external-file
arguments.description: is the name of an external output file.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: is a file reference that has been assigned to an external file. Use the FILENAME statement to assign a fileref.

arguments.name: entry.markup
arguments.description: specifies an entry in a SAS catalog to write to.

arguments.name: (DYNAMIC)
arguments.description: Send output directly to a web server instead of writing it to a file

arguments.name: (NO_BOTTOM_MATTER)
arguments.description: Specify that no ending markup language source code be added to the output file.

arguments.name: (NO_TOP_MATTER)
arguments.description: Specify that no beginning markup language source code be added to the top of the output file. For HTML 4.0, the NO_TOP_MATTER option removes the style sheet.

arguments.name: (TITLE='')
arguments.description: Insert into the metadata of a file, the text string that you specify as the text to appear in the browser window title bar.

arguments.name: title-text
arguments.description: is the text in the metadata of a file that indicates the title.

arguments.name: (URL= '' )
arguments.description: Specify a URL for the file-specification. ODS uses this URL (instead of the filename) in all the links and references that it creates and that point to the file.

arguments.name: PARAMETERS=
arguments.description: Write the specified parameters between the tags that generate dynamic graphics output

arguments.name: parameter-name
arguments.description: is the name of the parameter.

arguments.name: parameter-value
arguments.description: is the value of the parameter.

arguments.name: PATH=
arguments.description: Specify the location of an aggregate storage location or a SAS catalog for all markup files

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: specifies that no information from the PATH= option appears in the links or references.

arguments.name: RECORD_SEPARATOR=
arguments.description: Specify an alternative character or string to separate lines in the output files

arguments.name: alternative-separator
arguments.description: represents one or more characters in hexadecimal or ASCII format. For example, the following option specifies a record separator for a carriage return character and a linefeed character for use with an ASCII file system:

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: produces the markup language that is appropriate for the environment where you run the SAS job.

arguments.name: STYLE=
arguments.description: Specify a style template to use in writing output files

arguments.name: style-template
arguments.description: describes how to display the presentation aspects (color, font face, font size, and so on) of your SAS output. A style template determines the overall appearance of the documents that use it. Each style template consists of style elements.

arguments.name: STYLESHEET=
arguments.description: Open the HTML destination and place style information for output into an external file, or read style sheet information from an existing file

arguments.name: CLOSE
arguments.description: Close the destination and the file that is associated with it.

arguments.name: EXCLUDE

arguments.name: SELECT

arguments.name: SHOW

name: ODS LAYOUT ABSOLUTE
description: Enables you to specify an exact page location using x and y coordinates. Absolute layout is limited to one page and is supported only by the PDF destination

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: Specify alternate text for your layout containers and regions.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specify a vertical height of the layout.

arguments.name: dimension
arguments.description: is a nonnegative number followed by an optional unit of measure. It is not recommended that you use pixels because of adverse dependencies on resolution that can differ between destinations.

arguments.name: STYLE=
arguments.description: specifies one or more style elements to use for different parts of the layout.

arguments.name: WIDTH=
arguments.description: Specify the horizontal width of the layout.

arguments.name: dimension
arguments.description: is a nonnegative number followed by an optional unit of measure. It is not recommended that you use pixels because of adverse dependencies on resolution that can differ between destinations.

arguments.name: X=
arguments.description: Specify the horizontal position of the layout.

arguments.name: dimension
arguments.description: is a nonnegative number followed by an optional unit of measure. It is not recommended that you use pixels because of adverse dependencies on resolution that can differ between destinations.

arguments.name: Y=
arguments.description: Specify the vertical starting position of the layout.

arguments.name: dimension
arguments.description: is a nonnegative number followed by an optional unit of measure. It is not recommended that you use pixels because of adverse dependencies on resolution that can differ between destinations.

name: ODS LAYOUT END
description: Ends a gridded or absolute layout statement block.

name: ODS LAYOUT GRIDDED
description: Enables you to arrange output dynamically in a two-dimensional grid structure.

arguments.name: ADVANCE=
arguments.description: Dynamically populate the layout grid by groups, tables, pages, procedures, and explicitly.

arguments.name: BYGROUP
arguments.description: specifies that the gridded layout dynamically advance to a new region for every BYGROUP encountered.

arguments.name: EXPLICIT
arguments.description: specifies that the gridded layout dynamically populates the region explicitly before moving on to the next region. All output is in ONE region unless ODS REGION statements are being used.

arguments.name: PROC
arguments.description: specifies that the gridded layout dynamically populates the region by procedures before moving on to the next region.

arguments.name: TABLE
arguments.description: specifies that the gridded layout dynamically populates the region by tables before moving on to the next region.

arguments.name: OUTPUT
arguments.description: specifies that the gridded layout dynamically populates the region by output before moving on to the next region.

arguments.name: COLUMN=
arguments.description: Specify the fixed number of columns in a gridded layout.

arguments.name: COLUMN_GUTTER=
arguments.description: Specify the horizontal space between each column.

arguments.name: dimension
arguments.description: is a nonnegative number followed by an optional unit of measure. It is not recommended that you use pixels because of adverse dependencies on resolution that can differ between destinations.

arguments.name: COLUMN_WIDTHS=
arguments.description: Specify the width of each column specified.

arguments.name: dimension
arguments.description: is a nonnegative number followed by an optional unit of measure. It is not recommended that you use pixels because of adverse dependencies on resolution that can differ between destinations.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: Specify alternate text for your layout containers and regions.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specify the vertical height of the layout.

arguments.name: dimension
arguments.description: is a nonnegative number followed by an optional unit of measure. It is not recommended that you use pixels because of adverse dependencies on resolution that can differ between destinations.

arguments.name: ORDER_TYPE=
arguments.description: Populate the grid by rows or columns.

arguments.name: COLUMN_MAJOR
arguments.description: specifies that the gridded layout first populates all regions in the first column before moving on to the next column.

arguments.name: ROW_MAJOR
arguments.description: specifies that the gridded layout first populates all regions in the row before moving on to the next row.

arguments.name: ROWS=
arguments.description: Specify the fixed number of rows in the gridded layout.

arguments.name: ROW_GUTTER=
arguments.description: Specify the vertical space between each row.

arguments.name: dimension
arguments.description: is a nonnegative number followed by an optional unit of measure. It is not recommended that you use pixels because of adverse dependencies on resolution that can differ between destinations.

arguments.name: ROW_HEIGHTS=
arguments.description: Specify the height of each row specified.

arguments.name: dimension
arguments.description: is a nonnegative number followed by an optional unit of measure. It is not recommended that you use pixels because of adverse dependencies on resolution that can differ between destinations.

arguments.name: STYLE=
arguments.description: Specify one or more style elements to use for different parts of the layout.

arguments.name: WIDTH=
arguments.description: Specify the horizontal width of the layout.

arguments.name: dimension
arguments.description: is a nonnegative number followed by an optional unit of measure. It is not recommended that you use pixels because of adverse dependencies on resolution that can differ between destinations.

arguments.name: X=
arguments.description: Specify the horizontal starting position of the layout.

arguments.name: dimension
arguments.description: is a nonnegative number followed by an optional unit of measure. It is not recommended that you use pixels because of adverse dependencies on resolution that can differ between destinations.

arguments.name: Y=
arguments.description: Specify the vertical starting position of the layout.

arguments.name: dimension
arguments.description: is a nonnegative number followed by an optional unit of measure. It is not recommended that you use pixels because of adverse dependencies on resolution that can differ between destinations.

name: ODS MARKUP
description: Opens, manages, or closes the MARKUP destination, which produces SAS output that is formatted using one of many different markup languages.
help:
ODS MARKUP 
                <(<ID =>
                        identifier)>
                <action> ;
ODS MARKUP 
                <(<ID =>
                        identifier)>
                <options>
                <TAGSET =tagset-name>
                <action> ;
