arguments.description: starts a new body file for each page of output. A page break occurs when a procedure explicitly starts a new page (not because the page size was exceeded) or when you start a new procedure.

arguments.name: PROC
arguments.description: starts a new body file each time you start a new procedure.

arguments.name: OPTIONS
arguments.description: Specify tagset-specific suboptions and a named value

arguments.name: (DOC=''''''
arguments.description: provides information about the specified tagset.

arguments.name: HELP
arguments.description: provides generic help and information with a quick reference.

arguments.name: QUICK
arguments.description: describes the options available for this tagset.

arguments.name: SETTINGS
arguments.description: provides the current option settings.

arguments.name: CHANGELOG
arguments.description: lists a history of changes made to the tagset. This suboption is supported only on the RTF tagset.

arguments.name: suboptions
arguments.description: specifies one or more suboptions that are valid for the specified tagset. Suboptions have the following format.

arguments.name: PACKAGE
arguments.description: Specify that the output from the destination be added to an ODS package

arguments.name: package-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of a package that was created with the ODS PACKAGE statement. If no name is specified, then the output is added to the unnamed package that was opened last.

arguments.name: PAGE=
arguments.description: Open the HTML destination and specify the file that contains a description of each page of the body file and contains links to the body file

arguments.name: external-file
arguments.description: is the name of an external output file.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: is a file reference that has been assigned to an external file. Use the FILENAME statement to assign a fileref.

arguments.name: entry.markup
arguments.description: specifies an entry in a SAS catalog to write to.

arguments.name: (DYNAMIC)
arguments.description: Send output directly to a web server instead of writing it to a file

arguments.name: (NO_BOTTOM_MATTER)
arguments.description: Specify that no ending markup language source code be added to the output file.

arguments.name: (NO_TOP_MATTER)
arguments.description: Specify that no beginning markup language source code be added to the top of the output file. For HTML 4.0, the NO_TOP_MATTER option removes the style sheet.

arguments.name: (TITLE='')
arguments.description: Insert into the metadata of a file, the text string that you specify as the text to appear in the browser window title bar.

arguments.name: title-text
arguments.description: is the text in the metadata of a file that indicates the title.

arguments.name: (URL= '' )
arguments.description: Specify a URL for the file-specification. ODS uses this URL (instead of the filename) in all the links and references that it creates and that point to the file.

arguments.name: PARAMETERS=
arguments.description: Write the specified parameters between the tags that generate dynamic graphics output

arguments.name: parameter-name
arguments.description: is the name of the parameter.

arguments.name: parameter-value
arguments.description: is the value of the parameter.

arguments.name: PATH=
arguments.description: Specify the location of an aggregate storage location or a SAS catalog for all markup files

arguments.name: 'aggregate-file-storage-location'
arguments.description: specifies an aggregate storage location such as directory, folder, or partitioned data set.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: is a file reference that has been assigned to an aggregate storage location. Use the FILENAME statement to assign a fileref.

arguments.name: libref.catalog
arguments.description: specifies a SAS catalog to write to.

arguments.name: URL=
arguments.description: specifies a URL for the file-specification.

arguments.name: Uniform-Resource-Locator
arguments.description: is the URL that you specify. ODS uses this URL instead of the filename in all the links and references that it creates to the file.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: specifies that no information from the PATH= option appears in the links or references.

arguments.name: RECORD_SEPARATOR=
arguments.description: Specify an alternative character or string to separate lines in the output files

arguments.name: alternative-separator
arguments.description: represents one or more characters in hexadecimal or ASCII format. For example, the following option specifies a record separator for a carriage return character and a linefeed character for use with an ASCII file system:

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: produces the markup language that is appropriate for the environment where you run the SAS job.

arguments.name: STYLE=
arguments.description: Specify a style template to use in writing output files

arguments.name: style-template
arguments.description: describes how to display the presentation aspects (color, font face, font size, and so on) of your SAS output. A style template determines the overall appearance of the documents that use it. Each style template consists of style elements.

arguments.name: STYLESHEET=
arguments.description: Open the HTML destination and place style information for output into an external file, or read style sheet information from an existing file

arguments.name: external-file
arguments.description: is the name of an external output file.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: is a file reference that has been assigned to an external file. Use the FILENAME statement to assign a fileref.

arguments.name: entry.markup
arguments.description: specifies an entry in a SAS catalog to write to.

arguments.name: (DYNAMIC)
arguments.description: Send output directly to a web server instead of writing it to a file

arguments.name: (NO_BOTTOM_MATTER)
arguments.description: Specify that no ending markup language source code be added to the output file.

arguments.name: (NO_TOP_MATTER)
arguments.description: Specify that no beginning markup language source code be added to the top of the output file. For HTML 4.0, the NO_TOP_MATTER option removes the style sheet.

arguments.name: (TITLE='')
arguments.description: Insert into the metadata of a file, the text string that you specify as the text to appear in the browser window title bar.

arguments.name: title-text
arguments.description: is the text in the metadata of a file that indicates the title.

arguments.name: (URL= '' )
arguments.description: Specify a URL for the file-specification. ODS uses this URL (instead of the filename) in all the links and references that it creates and that point to the file.

arguments.name: TAGSET=
arguments.description: Specify a keyword value for a tagset. A tagset is a template that defines how to create a markup language output type from a SAS format.

arguments.name: TEXT=
arguments.description: Insert text into your document

arguments.name: TRANTAB=
arguments.description: Specify a translation table to use when transcoding a file for output

arguments.name: CLOSE
arguments.description: Close the destination and the file that is associated with it.

arguments.name: EXCLUDE
arguments.description: Exclude output objects from the destination

arguments.name: SELECT
arguments.description: Select output objects for the destination.

arguments.name: SHOW
arguments.description: Write to the SAS Log the current selection or exclusion list for the destination

name: ODS NOPROCTITLE
description: Suppresses the title of the procedure that produces the results.

name: ODS OUTPUT
description: Produces a SAS data set from an output object and manages the selection and exclusion lists for the OUTPUT destination.
help:
ODS OUTPUT  action;
ODS OUTPUT  data-set-definition(s);

arguments.name: output-object
arguments.description: identifies one or more output objects to turn into a SAS data set.

arguments.name: MATCH_ALL=
arguments.description: creates a new data set for each output object. For an explanation of how ODS names these data sets, see the discussion of the option .

arguments.name: macro-var-name
arguments.description: specifies the macro variable where a list of all the data sets that are created are stored. If you want to concatenate all the data sets after the PROC step, you can use the macro variable to specify all the data sets in a DATA step.

arguments.name: PERSIST=
arguments.description: determines when ODS closes any data sets that it is creating, and determines when ODS removes output objects from the selection list for the OUTPUT destination.

arguments.name: PROC
arguments.description: maintains the list of definitions even after the procedure ends, until you explicitly modify it. To modify the list, use ODS OUTPUT with one or more data-set-specifications. To set the list for the OUTPUT destination to EXCLUDE ALL, use the following statement:

arguments.name: RUN
arguments.description: maintains the list of definitions and keeps open the data sets that it is creating even if the procedure or DATA step ends, or until you explicitly modify the list.

arguments.name: data-set
arguments.description: names the SAS output data set. You can use a one-level or two-level (with a libref) name.

arguments.name: NOWARN
arguments.description: suppresses the warning that an output object was requested but not created.

arguments.name: SHOW
arguments.description: functions just like the ODS SHOW statement except that it writes only the selection or exclusion list for the OUTPUT destination.

arguments.name: CLEAR
arguments.description: sets the list for the OUTPUT destination to EXCLUDE ALL.

arguments.name: CLOSE
arguments.description: closes the OUTPUT destination. When an ODS destination is closed, ODS does not send output to that destination. Closing a destination frees some system resources.

arguments.name: SHOW
arguments.description: writes to the SAS log the current selection or exclusion list for the OUTPUT destination. If the list is the default list (EXCLUDE ALL), then SHOW also writes the current overall selection or exclusion list.

name: ODS PACKAGE
description: Opens, adds to, publishes, or closes one SAS Output Delivery System (ODS) package object.

arguments.name: ADD
arguments.description: adds a file or data set to an ODS package using the specified Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) type.

arguments.name: FILE=
arguments.description: specifies the file that you want to add to an ODS package.

arguments.name: external-file
arguments.description: is the name of an external file to add.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: is a file reference that has been assigned to an external file. Use the FILENAME statement to assign a fileref.

arguments.name: TEXT
arguments.description: specifies that the file is a text file.

arguments.name: BINARY
arguments.description: specifies that the file is a binary file.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: specifies the data set that you want to add to an ODS package. member-specification can be in the form libname.membername or membername.

arguments.name: MIMETYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) type for the file or data set that you are adding to an ODS package.

arguments.name: OPEN
arguments.description: creates the ODS package object to which the ODS destinations can connect. The ODS package object holds the package metadata and tracks the locations of any files that are added to the package metadata.

arguments.name: PUBLISH
arguments.description: builds the ODS package and sends it to the chosen delivery transport.

arguments.name: CLOSE
arguments.description: deletes the package object. As long as you have not closed a package, you can publish it as many ways and times as you want.

arguments.name: ARCHIVE
arguments.description: publishes a package to an archive. For a list of transport properties and their values, see the section on transport properties in .

arguments.name: EMAIL
arguments.description: publishes a package to one or more e-mail addresses. For a list of transport properties and their values, see the section on transport properties in .

arguments.name: QUEUE
arguments.description: publishes a package to one or more message queues. For a list of transport properties and their values, see the section on transport properties in .

arguments.name: SUBSCRIBERS
arguments.description: publishes a package to subscribers who are associated with the specified channel. For a list of transport properties and their values, see the section on transport properties in .

arguments.name: WEBDAV
arguments.description: publishes a package to a WebDAV-compliant server. For a list of transport properties and their values, see the section on transport properties in .

arguments.name: ABSTRACT=
arguments.description: specifies a string for the abstract metadata of the package or file.

arguments.name: CLEAR
arguments.description: specifies that all files that were automatically added to the package will be removed from the location to which ODS wrote them.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: specifies a string for the description metadata for the package or file.

arguments.name: EXPIRATION=
arguments.description: specifies an expiration date for the package. The date must be a SAS date value.

arguments.name: (name)
arguments.description: specifies the name of a package. Naming a package enables you to open more than one package at a time. Each destination can connect with any package by specifying the package name in the same way.

arguments.name: NAMEVALUE=
arguments.description: specifies a string of name/value pairs for the name/value metadata on the package or file.

arguments.name: PATH=
arguments.description: places the file or data set at the specified pathname within an ODS package.

name: ODS PATH
description: The ODS PATH statement controls where ODS stores new templates that you create and where ODS finds the templates that your programs use.
help:
ODS PATH  <(APPEND | PREPEND | REMOVE) >  location(s);
ODS PATH  path-argument;

arguments.name: <libref.>item-store
arguments.description: identifies an item store to read from, to write to, or to update. If an item store does not already exist, then the ODS PATH statement will create it.

arguments.name: (READ)
arguments.description: provides Read-Only access. READ is the default.

arguments.name: (WRITE)
arguments.description: provides Write access (always creating a new template store) as well as Read access. READ is the default.

arguments.name: (UPDATE)
arguments.description: provides Update access (creating a new template store only if the specified one does not exist) as well as Read access. READ is the default.

arguments.name: RESET
arguments.description: sets the ODS path to the default settings Sasuser.Templat (UPDATE) and Sashelp.Tmplmst (READ).

arguments.name: SHOW
arguments.description: displays the current ODS path.

arguments.name: VERIFY
arguments.description: sets the ODS path to include only templates supplied by SAS. VERIFY is the same as specifying ODS PATH Sashelp.Tmplmst (READ).

arguments.name: (APPEND)
arguments.description: adds one or more locations to the end of a path. When you append a location to a path, all duplicate instances (same name and same permissions) of that item store are removed from the path. Only the last item store with the same name and permissions are kept.

arguments.name: (PREPEND)
arguments.description: adds one or more locations to the beginning of a path. When you prepend a location with Update permissions to a path, all duplicate instances (same name and same permissions) of that item store are removed from the path. Only the first item store with the same name and permissions are kept.

arguments.name: (REMOVE)
arguments.description: removes one or more locations from a path.

name: ODS PDF
description: Opens, manages, or closes the PDF destination, which produces PDF output, a form of output that is read by Adobe Acrobat and other applications.

arguments.name: ANCHOR=
arguments.description: Specify the root name for the anchor tag that identifies each output object in the current file

arguments.name: anchor-name
arguments.description: is the root name for the anchor tag that identifies each output object in the current file.

arguments.name: ACCESSIBLE
arguments.description: Adds non-visual metadata to the PDF file that enables the file to be accessed by assistive technology such as a screen reader.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: adds non-visual metadata to the PDF file that enables the file to be accessed by assistive technology such as a screen reader.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: does not add non-visual metadata to the PDF file that enables the file to be accessed by assistive technology such as a screen reader.

arguments.name: NOACCESSIBLE
arguments.description: Suppresses non-visual metadata to the PDF file that enables the file to be accessed by assistive technology such as a screen reader.

arguments.name: ACCESSIBLE_IDENTIFIER
arguments.description: Specifies that an identifier is added to the metadata of the PDF file, which confirms that the PDF produced by SAS meets the PDF Matterhorn Protocol. To suppress an identifier, specify the NOACCESSIBLE_IDENTIFIER option. NOACCESSIBLE_IDENTIFIER is the default.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: specifies that an identifier is added to the metadata of the PDF file confirming that the PDF produced by SAS meets the PDF Matterhorn Protocol.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: specifies that no identifier is added to the metadata of the PDF file confirming that the PDF produced by SAS meets the PDF Matterhorn Protocol.

arguments.name: NOACCESSIBLE_IDENTIFIER
arguments.description: Specifies that no identifier is added to the metadata of the PDF file confirming that the PDF produced by SAS meets the PDF Matterhorn Protocol. To add an identifier, use the ACCESSIBLE_IDENTIFIER option. NOACCESSIBLE_IDENTIFIER is the default.

arguments.name: AUTHOR=
arguments.description: Insert the text string that you specify as the author into the metadata of a file

arguments.name: author-text
arguments.description: is the text in the metadata of an open file that indicates the author.

arguments.name: BASE=
arguments.description: Specify a string to use as the first part of all references that ODS creates in the file

arguments.name: base-text
arguments.description: is the text that ODS uses as the first part of all references that ODS creates in the file.

arguments.name: BOOKMARKGEN
arguments.description: Control the generation of bookmarks in PDF files

arguments.name: BOOKMARKGEN
arguments.description: specifies to generate bookmarks in PDF files.

arguments.name: NOBOOKMARKGEN
arguments.description: specifies not to generate bookmarks in the PDF files.

arguments.name: NOBOOKMARKGEN
arguments.description: Control the generation of bookmarks in PDF files

arguments.name: BOOKMARKGEN
arguments.description: specifies to generate bookmarks in PDF files.

arguments.name: NOBOOKMARKGEN
arguments.description: specifies not to generate bookmarks in the PDF files.

arguments.name: BOOKMARKLEVEL=
arguments.description: Controls the level of table of contents detail that is collected in PDF documents.

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies with a positive, whole number the level of table of contents detail that is collected and available.

arguments.name: BOOKMARKLIST=
arguments.description: Specify whether to generate and display the list of bookmarks for PDF files

arguments.name: HIDE
arguments.description: generates a list of bookmarks for your PDF file. The bookmarks are not automatically displayed when you open the PDF file.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: specifies not to generate a list of bookmarks for your PDF files.

arguments.name: SHOW
arguments.description: generates a list of bookmarks for your PDF file. The bookmarks are automatically displayed when you open the PDF file.

arguments.name: BOOKMARKTYPE=
arguments.description: Formats by traditional or customized means your PDF document output.

arguments.name: LEGACY
arguments.description: displays the traditional table of contents and printable table of contents.

arguments.name: HEADINGS
arguments.description: builds a custom table of contents and a printable table of contents by honoring the heading levels set in the template produced by the PROC ODSTEXT HEADING statement.

arguments.name: BOX_SIZING=
arguments.description: Specify how to measure the width of cells. Use to override the default value of BOX_SIZING for a destination

arguments.name: COLOR=
arguments.description: Apply a specified color scheme to your output

arguments.name: FULL
arguments.description: creates full color output for both text and graphics.

arguments.name: GRAY
arguments.description: creates gray scale output for both text and graphics.

arguments.name: MONO
arguments.description: creates monochromatic output for both text and graphics.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description:
does not use all the color information that the style template provides. If you specify COLOR=NO, then the destination does this:
• generates black and white output
• creates all text and rules in black
• sets the SAS/GRAPH device to produce SAS/GRAPH output in gray scale
• ignores specifications for a background color from the style template except for the purposes of determining whether to print rules for the table

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description:
uses all the color information that a style template provides, including background color. To print in color, you must also do the following:
• use a printer that is capable of printing in color.
• use the COLORPRINTING SAS system option. For information about the COLORPRINTING system option, see .

arguments.name: COLUMNS=
arguments.description: Specify the number of columns to create on each page of output

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: is the number columns per page.

arguments.name: COMPRESS=
arguments.description: Specify the compression of a PDF file. Compression reduces the size of the file

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies the level of compression. The larger the number, the greater the compression. For example, n=0 is completely uncompressed, and n=9 is the maximum compression level.

arguments.name: CONTENTS=
arguments.description: Control the generation of a printable table of contents

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: does not generate a printable table of contents.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: generates a printable table of contents.

arguments.name: CSSSTYLE=
arguments.description: Specify a cascading style sheet to apply to your output

arguments.name: "external-file"
arguments.description: is the name of the external file.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: is a file reference that has been assigned to an external file. Use the FILENAME statement to assign a fileref.

arguments.name: "URL"
arguments.description: is a URL to an external file.

arguments.name: (media-type-1<.. media-type-10>)
arguments.description: specifies one or more media blocks that correspond to the type of media that your output is rendered on. CSS uses media type blocks to specify how a document is to be presented on different media: on the screen, on paper, with a speech synthesizer, with a braille device, and so on.

arguments.name: DOM
arguments.description: Specify that the ODS document object model is written to the SAS Log or to an external file

arguments.name: external-file
arguments.description: is the name of an external output file.

arguments.name: DPI=
arguments.description: Specify the image resolution in dots per inch for output images

arguments.name: FILE=
arguments.description: Specify the output file.

arguments.name: external-file
arguments.description: is the name of an external file.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: is a file reference that has been assigned to an external file. Use the FILENAME statement to assign a fileref.

arguments.name: GFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: Specify the location where footnotes are printed in the graphics output

arguments.name: GFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: includes all of the currently defined footnotes within the graphics output.

arguments.name: NOGFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: prevents all of the currently defined footnotes from appearing in the graphics file. Instead, they become part of the Printer file.

arguments.name: NOGFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: Specify the location where footnotes are printed in the graphics output

arguments.name: GFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: includes all of the currently defined footnotes within the graphics output.

arguments.name: NOGFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: prevents all of the currently defined footnotes from appearing in the graphics file. Instead, they become part of the Printer file.

arguments.name: GTITLE
arguments.description: Control the location where titles are printed in the graphics output

arguments.name: GTITLE
arguments.description: includes all of the currently defined titles within the graphics output.

arguments.name: NOGTITLE
arguments.description: prevents all of the currently defined titles from appearing in the graphics output. Instead, the titles become part of the Printer file.

arguments.name: NOGTITLE
arguments.description: Control the location where titles are printed in the graphics output

arguments.name: GTITLE
arguments.description: includes all of the currently defined titles within the graphics output.

arguments.name: NOGTITLE
arguments.description: prevents all of the currently defined titles from appearing in the graphics output. Instead, the titles become part of the Printer file.

arguments.name: (<ID=> )
arguments.description: Open multiple instances of the same destination at the same time

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: can be numeric or can be a series of characters that begin with a letter or an underscore. Subsequent characters can include letters, underscores, and numerals.

arguments.name: KEYWORDS=
arguments.description: Insert a string of keywords into the output file's metadata

arguments.name: keywords-text
arguments.description: is the string of keywords.

arguments.name: NEWFILE=
arguments.description: Create a new file at the specified starting-point

arguments.name: BYGROUP
arguments.description: starts a new file for the results of each BY group.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: writes all output to the file that is currently open.

arguments.name: OUTPUT
arguments.description: starts a new file for each output object. For SAS/GRAPH this means that ODS creates a new file for each SAS/GRAPH output file that the program generates.

arguments.name: PAGE
arguments.description: starts a new file for each page of output. A page break occurs when a procedure explicitly starts a new page (not because the page size was exceeded) or when you start a new procedure.

arguments.name: PROC
arguments.description: starts a body file each time you start a new procedure.

arguments.name: NOTOC
arguments.description: Omit the table of contents (Bookmark list) that is produced by default when producing PDF or PDFMARK output

arguments.name: PACKAGE
arguments.description: Specify that the output from the destination be added to an ODS package

arguments.name: package-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of a package that was created with the ODS PACKAGE statement. If no name is specified, then the output is added to the unnamed package that was opened last.

arguments.name: PDFNOTE
arguments.description: Control whether notes are added to a PDF file for items that are associated with the FLYOVER= style attribute

arguments.name: PDFNOTE
arguments.description: adds notes to a PDF file for items that are associated with the FLYOVER= style attribute.

arguments.name: NOPDFNOTE
arguments.description: modifies the behavior of PDFMARK so that notes are not added to the file for items that are associated with the FLYOVER= style attribute.

arguments.name: NOPDFNOTE
arguments.description: Control whether notes are added to a PDF file for items that are associated with the FLYOVER= style attribute

arguments.name: PDFNOTE
arguments.description: adds notes to a PDF file for items that are associated with the FLYOVER= style attribute.

arguments.name: NOPDFNOTE
arguments.description: modifies the behavior of PDFMARK so that notes are not added to the file for items that are associated with the FLYOVER= style attribute.

arguments.name: PDFTOC=
arguments.description: Control the level of the expansion of the bookmarks tree in PDF documents

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies the level of expansion. For example, PDFTOC=0 results in a fully expanded bookmarks tree. PDFTOC=2 results in a bookmarks tree that is expanded to two levels.

arguments.name: STARTPAGE=
arguments.description: Control page breaks

arguments.name: BYGROUP
arguments.description: specifies to insert page breaks after each BY group.

arguments.name: NEVER
arguments.description: specifies not to insert page breaks, even before graphics procedures.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: specifies that no new pages be inserted at the beginning of each procedure, or within certain procedures, even if new pages are requested by the procedure code. A new page begins only when a page is filled or when you specify STARTPAGE=NOW.

arguments.name: NOW
arguments.description: forces the immediate insertion of a new page.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: inserts a new page at the beginning of each procedure, and within certain procedures, as requested by the procedure code.

arguments.name: STYLE=
arguments.description: Specify the style template to use in writing the PDF output

arguments.name: SUBJECT=
arguments.description: Insert the text string that you specify as the subject in the metadata of a file

arguments.name: subject-text
arguments.description: is the text in the metadata of a file that indicates the subject.

arguments.name: TEXT=
arguments.description: Insert text into your output

arguments.name: text-string
arguments.description: is the text that you want to insert into your output.

arguments.name: TITLE=
arguments.description: Insert the text string that you specify as the title in the metadata of a file

arguments.name: title-text
arguments.description: is the text in the metadata of a file that indicates the title.

arguments.name: UNIFORM
arguments.description: For multi-page tables, provide uniformity from page to page within a single table

arguments.name: CLOSE
arguments.description: Close the destination and the file that is associated with it.

arguments.name: EXCLUDE
arguments.description: Exclude output objects from the destination

arguments.name: SELECT
arguments.description: Select output objects for the destination.

arguments.name: SHOW
arguments.description: Write to the SAS Log the current selection or exclusion list for the destination

name: ODS POWERPOINT

ODS POWERPOINT  <(<ID => identifier)> <action> ;
ODS POWERPOINT  <(<ID => identifier)> <options> ;

arguments.name: AUTHOR=
arguments.description: Specify the author of the PowerPoint document

arguments.name: BOX_SIZING=
arguments.description: Specify how to measure the width of cells. Use to override the default value of BOX_SIZING for a destination

arguments.name: CATEGORY=
arguments.description: Specify the category of the PowerPoint document

arguments.name: COMMENTS=
arguments.description: Add comments to the properties of the PowerPoint document

arguments.name: FILE=
arguments.description: Specify the file that contains the PowerPoint created by the destination

arguments.name: external-file
arguments.description: is the name of an external file to receive output.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: is a file reference that has been assigned to an external file. Use the FILENAME statement to assign a fileref.

arguments.name: GFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: Control the location where footnotes are printed in the graphics output

arguments.name: GFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: prints footnotes that are created by SAS/GRAPH, the SGPLOT procedure, the SGPANEL procedure, or the SGSCATTER procedure. The footnotes appear inside the graph borders.

arguments.name: NOGFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: prints footnotes that are created by ODS, which appear outside the graph borders.

arguments.name: NOGFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: Control the location where footnotes are printed in the graphics output

arguments.name: GFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: prints footnotes that are created by SAS/GRAPH, the SGPLOT procedure, the SGPANEL procedure, or the SGSCATTER procedure. The footnotes appear inside the graph borders.

arguments.name: NOGFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: prints footnotes that are created by ODS, which appear outside the graph borders.

arguments.name: GTITLE
arguments.description: Control the location where titles are printed in the graphics output

arguments.name: GTITLE
arguments.description: prints the title that is created by SAS/GRAPH, the SGPLOT procedure, the SGPANEL procedure, or the SGSCATTER procedure. The title appears inside the graph borders.

arguments.name: NOGTITLE
arguments.description: prints the title that is created by ODS, which appears outside of the graph borders.

arguments.name: NOGTITLE

arguments.name: GTITLE
arguments.description: prints the title that is created by SAS/GRAPH, the SGPLOT procedure, the SGPANEL procedure, or the SGSCATTER procedure. The title appears inside the graph borders.

arguments.name: IMAGE_DPI
arguments.description: Specify the image resolution for the graphical output

arguments.name: KEYWORDS=
arguments.description: Add keywords to the PowerPoint document properties

arguments.name: LAYOUT=
arguments.description: Specify a predefined gridded layout

arguments.name: Titleslide
arguments.description: specifies the layout for the title slide.

arguments.name: TitleandContent
arguments.description: specifies a slide with a title and content.

arguments.name: TwoContent
arguments.description: specifies slides with a two-column layout. The options that can be specified for ADVANCE= are listed below.

arguments.name: ADVANCE=
arguments.description: specifies that the grid is dynamically populated by groups, tables, output, and procedures. If nothing is specified for TwoContent, the grid is populated by PROC.

arguments.name: BYGROUP
arguments.description: specifies that the gridded layout dynamically advance to a new region for every BYGROUP encountered.

arguments.name: OUTPUT
arguments.description: specifies that the gridded layout dynamically populates the region by output before moving on to the next region.

arguments.name: PROC
arguments.description: specifies that the gridded layout dynamically populates the region by procedures before moving on to the next region.

arguments.name: TABLE
arguments.description: specifies that the gridded layout dynamically populates the region by tables before moving on to the next region.

arguments.name: OPTIONS
arguments.description: Specify suboptions and a named value when using the ODS POWERPONT destination
arguments.help: OPTIONS (                      ADVANCE_AFTER=ADVANCE_ON_MOUSE_CLICK= | BACKGROUNDCOLOR= | BACKGROUNDIMAGE= | BACKGROUNDREPEAT= | DURATION= | EFFECT_OPTION= | SOUND= | TRANSITION=                      )

arguments.name: ADVANCE_AFTER=
arguments.description: specifies the number of seconds to display the current slide before automatically proceeding to the next slide. This option is used to create presentations that advance automatically.

arguments.name: ADVANCE_ON_MOUSE_CLICK=
arguments.description: is used in conjunction with the ADVANCE_AFTER= option. The default is 'YES'. By default PowerPoint waits for a mouse click to proceed to the next slide. Specify ADVANCE_ON_MOUSE_CLICK=“NO” to disable this and proceed automatically. Leave ADVANCE_ON_MOUSE_CLICK=“YES” to allow a mouse click to advance to the next slide.

arguments.name: BACKGROUNDCOLOR=
arguments.description: specifies the color of the background of the slides.

arguments.name: BACKGROUNDIMAGE=
arguments.description: specifies an image or a gradient to use as the background for the slides.

arguments.name: external-file
arguments.description: is the name and optional path of an external image file.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: is a file reference that has been assigned to an external file. Use the FILENAME statement to assign a fileref.

arguments.name: LINEAR-GRADIENT
arguments.description: A linear gradient is defined by a gradient line on which the color-stops are arranged. One way to describe the gradient line is by naming a side or corner. Another way is to describe the gradient line as a line passing through the center of the gradient box and rotated by an angle.

arguments.name: side-or-corner,
arguments.description: The gradient line begins at the named side or corner and extends to the opposite side or corner. For example, if the starting point is “top”, the gradient ray extends to the bottom.

arguments.name: angle,
arguments.description: You can describe the gradient line as a line passing through the center of the gradient box and rotated by an angle. The angle is measured in degrees. The angle 0-degrees points to the right and 90-degrees points up. Positive angles go counterclockwise. In the direction of the angle, the ending-point is the point on the gradient-line where a line drawn perpendicular to the gradient-line would intersect the corner of the box in that direction. The starting-point is determined identically, except in the opposite direction of the angle. See .

arguments.name: color-stop
arguments.description: A color-stop argument specifies a color. The position argument is optional. If a position is present, it is specified as a percentage between 0% and 100%. At each color-stop, the gradient line or ray is the color of the color-stop. Between two color-stops, the color is linearly interpolated between the colors of the two color stops.

arguments.name: side-or-corner,
arguments.description: The gradient line begins at the named side or corner and extends to the opposite side or corner. For example, if the starting point is “top”, the gradient ray extends to the bottom.

arguments.name: angle,
arguments.description: You can describe the gradient line as a line passing through the center of the gradient box and rotated by an angle. The angle is measured in degrees. The angle 0-degrees points to the right and 90-degrees points up. Positive angles go counterclockwise. In the direction of the angle, the ending-point is the point on the gradient-line where a line drawn perpendicular to the gradient-line would intersect the corner of the box in that direction. The starting-point is determined identically, except in the opposite direction of the angle. See .

arguments.name: color-stop
arguments.description: A color-stop argument specifies a color. The position argument is optional. If a position is present, it is specified as a percentage between 0% and 100%. At each color-stop, the gradient line or ray is the color of the color-stop. Between two color-stops, the color is linearly interpolated between the colors of the two color stops.

arguments.name: RADIAL-GRADIENT
arguments.description: A radial gradient is defined by a gradient ray that starts in the center of the gradient and extends outward. Color-stops are positioned along the gradient ray starting in the center of the gradient toward the right. At each color-stop, the circle surrounding the center of the gradient has the specified color. Between color-stops the color is linearly interpolated between the colors of the adjacent color-stops.
arguments.help:
RADIAL-GRADIENT                                     (< shape> size
                               position,                                  color-stop [,                                  color-stop]+)

arguments.name: shape
arguments.description: If present it can be either CIRCLE or ELLIPSE. The destination for PowerPoint always uses CIRCLE no matter which shape is specified or if no shape is specified.

arguments.name: size
arguments.description: The gradient is always sized to meet the corner of the box farthest from the center. This sizing is called “farthest-corner” or “cover ” in the CSS language.

arguments.name: position
arguments.description: The position designates the center of the gradient in the box in which the gradient appears. It can be center or one of the corners topleft, topright, bottomleft, or bottomright.

arguments.name: color-stop
arguments.description: A color-stop specifies a color. The position argument is optional. If a position is present, it is specified as a percentage between 0% and 100%. At each color-stop, the gradient line or ray is the color of the color-stop. Between two color-stops, the color is linearly interpolated between the colors of the two color-stops.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: turns off the background image and returns to the default.

arguments.name: BACKGROUNDREPEAT=
arguments.description: specifies whether the image used for the slide background is repeated horizontally, vertically, both, or not repeated. option can be one of the following:

arguments.name: NO_REPEAT
arguments.description: specifies that the image is not repeated.

arguments.name: REPEAT
arguments.description: specifies that the image is repeated both horizontally and vertically.

arguments.name: DURATION=
arguments.description: specifies a non-default value for the duration of the transition. All transitions have a default duration. Use this option to specify a non-default value for the duration of the transition. The option value is a decimal number of seconds. For example, duration="1.5" sets the duration to one and a half seconds.

arguments.name: EFFECT_OPTION=
arguments.description: specifies a variation of the transition. All of the EFFECT_OPTION options supported by Microsoft PowerPoint 2013 are supported by the ODS POWERPOINT destination. See for a list of the options supported for the EFFECT_OPTION.

arguments.name: SOUND=
arguments.description: specifies the name of a .wav file to play during the transition.

arguments.name: filename
arguments.description: specifies the name of a .wav file to play during the transition. Filename can be either a fileref or the path to a .wav file. For example, if the fileref MYSOUND is associated with the file c:\sounds\thunder.wav, you can specify SOUND="MYSOUND". Alternatively, you can specify the path explicitly: SOUND="c:\sounds\thunder.wav".

arguments.name: TRANSITION=
arguments.description: specifies the name of a transition to be used between slides. The transition applies starting with the next slide created and is applied between every succeeding slide until another transition is specified or TRANSITION="NONE" is specified.

arguments.name: ''name''
arguments.description: can be any of the 47 transitions supported by PowerPoint 2013. See for a list of the transition names.

arguments.name: 'NONE'
arguments.description: specifies that the default transition is used.

arguments.name: SASDATE
arguments.description: Insert the standard SAS date in the document in place of the default PowerPoint date and time field

arguments.name: STARTPAGE=
arguments.description: Controls insertion of new slides

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: inserts a new slide at the start of each table or graph.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: instructs ODS not to insert any new slides at the start of each procedure or within certain procedures, even if the procedure code requests new slides. A new slide begins only when a slide is filled or when you specify STARTPAGE= NOW.

arguments.name: NOW
arguments.description: forces the immediate insertion of a new slide.

arguments.name: STATUS=
arguments.description: Insert the status of the PowerPoint document

arguments.name: STYLE=
arguments.description: Specifies one or more style-override(s) to use when writing output files

arguments.name: TITLE=
arguments.description: Specify a title for the PowerPoint document

arguments.name: WORK=
arguments.description: Specify an alternate directory for the temporary files

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: is a file reference that has been assigned to a directory. Use the FILENAME statement to assign a fileref.

arguments.name: directory-name
arguments.description: is the name of the directory.

arguments.name: CLOSE
arguments.description: Close the destination and the file that is associated with it

arguments.name: EXCLUDE
arguments.description: Exclude output objects from the destination

arguments.name: SELECT
arguments.description: Select output objects for the destination.

arguments.name: SHOW
arguments.description: Write to the SAS Log the current selection or exclusion list for the destination

arguments.name: SUBJECT=
arguments.description: Insert the text string that you specify as the subject in the metadata of a file

arguments.name: subject-text
arguments.description: specifies the text in the metadata of a file that indicates the subject.

name: ODS PROCLABEL
description: Enables you to change a procedure label.

arguments.name: 'string'
arguments.description: is the procedure label that you specify.

name: ODS PROCTITLE
description: Writes, in the output, the name of the procedure that produces the results.

name: ODS REGION
description: Creates a region container for absolute layouts. A region can contain output (such as text, tables, images, graphs) or nested layout containers.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: Specify alternate text for your layout containers and regions.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specify a vertical height of the region.

arguments.name: dimension
arguments.description: is a nonnegative number followed by an optional unit of measure. It is not recommended that you use pixels because of adverse dependencies on resolution that can differ between destinations.

arguments.name: STYLE=
arguments.description: Specify one or more style elements to use for different parts of the layout.

arguments.name: WIDTH=
arguments.description: Specify the horizontal width of the region.

arguments.name: dimension
arguments.description: is a nonnegative number followed by an optional unit of measure. It is not recommended that you use pixels because of adverse dependencies on resolution that can differ between destinations.

arguments.name: X=
arguments.description: Specify the horizontal starting position of the region.

arguments.name: dimension
arguments.description: is a nonnegative number followed by an optional unit of measure. It is not recommended that you use pixels because of adverse dependencies on resolution that can differ between destinations.

arguments.name: Y=
arguments.description: Specify the starting vertical position of the region.

arguments.name: dimension
arguments.description: is a nonnegative number followed by an optional unit of measure. It is not recommended that you use pixels because of adverse dependencies on resolution that can differ between destinations.

name: ODS RTF
description: Opens, manages, or closes the RTF destination, which produces output written in Rich Text Format for use with Microsoft Word..
help:
ODS RTF 
            <(<ID =>
                  identifier)>
            action;
ODS RTF 
            <(<ID =>
                  identifier)>
            <options> ;

arguments.name: ANCHOR=
arguments.description: Specify a unique base name for the anchor tag that identifies each output object in the current body file

arguments.name: anchor-name
arguments.description: is the base name for the RTF anchor tag that identifies each output object in the current file.

arguments.name: AUTHOR=
arguments.description: Specify the text string that identifies the author. This text string is inserted into the metadata of a file.

arguments.name: author-text
arguments.description: is the text in the metadata of an open file that indicates the author.

arguments.name: BASE=
arguments.description: Specify text to use as the first part of all links and references that ODS creates in output files

arguments.name: base-text
arguments.description: is the text that ODS uses as the first part of all references that ODS creates in the file. Consider this specification:

arguments.name: BODYTITLE
arguments.description: Specify that the titles and footnotes are to be placed into the body of the RTF document and not into the header and footer sections

arguments.name: BODYTITLE_AUX
arguments.description: Specify that the titles and footnotes are to be placed into the body of the RTF document and not into the header and footer sections. The titles and footnotes are also placed into cells or tables

arguments.name: BOX_SIZING=
arguments.description: Specify how to measure the width of cells. Use to override the default value of BOX_SIZING for a destination

arguments.name: COLUMNS=
arguments.description: Specify the number of columns to create on each page of output

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: is the number of one-inch columns that you want on the page.

arguments.name: MAX
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of columns for the paper size and margin setting. This value is dependent upon the paper size and page orientation.

arguments.name: CONTENTS
arguments.description: Specify whether to produce a table of contents page

arguments.name: CSSSTYLE=
arguments.description: Specify a cascading style sheet to apply to your output

arguments.name: "external-file"
arguments.description: is the name of the external file.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: is a file reference that has been assigned to an external file. Use the FILENAME statement to assign a fileref.

arguments.name: "URL"
arguments.description: is a URL to an external file.

arguments.name: (media-type-1<.. media-type-10>)
arguments.description: specifies one or more media blocks that correspond to the type of media that your output is rendered on. CSS uses media type blocks to specify how a document is to be presented on different media: on the screen, on paper, with a speech synthesizer, with a braille device, and so on.

arguments.name: DEVICE=
arguments.description: Specify a device for the RTF output destination

arguments.name: DOM
arguments.description: Specify that the ODS document object model is written to the SAS Log or to an external file

arguments.name: external-file

arguments.name: ENCODING=

arguments.name: external-file

arguments.description: is a file reference that has been assigned to an external file. Use the FILENAME statement to assign a fileref.

arguments.description: Specify the location where footnotes are printed in the graphics output

arguments.name: GFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: includes all of the currently defined footnotes within the graphics output.

arguments.name: NOGFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: prevents all of the currently defined footnotes from appearing in the graphics file. Instead, they become part of the RTF file.

arguments.name: NOGFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: Specify the location where footnotes are printed in the graphics output

arguments.description: includes all of the currently defined footnotes within the graphics output.

arguments.name: NOGFOOTNOTE
arguments.description: prevents all of the currently defined footnotes from appearing in the graphics file. Instead, they become part of the RTF file.

arguments.name: GTITLE

arguments.name: NOGTITLE

arguments.name: NOGTITLE

arguments.name: (ID= )
arguments.description: Open multiple instances of the same destination at the same time

arguments.name: identifier
arguments.description: specifies another instance of the destination that is already open. identifier is numeric or a series of characters that begin with a letter or an underscore. Subsequent characters can include letters, underscores, and numeric characters.

arguments.name: IMAGE_DPI
arguments.description: Specify the image resolution for the graphical output

arguments.name: KEEPN
arguments.description: Control where tables split on a page

arguments.name: KEEPN
arguments.description: ODS allows table splits only if the entire table cannot fit on one page.

arguments.name: NOKEEPN
arguments.description: ODS lets a table split at a page break.

arguments.name: NOKEEPN
arguments.description: Control where tables split on a page

arguments.name: KEEPN
arguments.description: ODS allows table splits only if the entire table cannot fit on one page.

arguments.name: NOKEEPN
arguments.description: ODS lets a table split at a page break.

arguments.name: NEWFILE=
arguments.description: Create a new body file at the specified starting point

arguments.name: BYGROUP
arguments.description: starts a new file for the results of each BY group.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: writes all output to the body file that is currently open.

arguments.name: OUTPUT
arguments.description: starts a new file for each output object. For SAS/GRAPH this means that ODS creates a new file for each SAS/GRAPH output file that the program generates.

arguments.name: PROC
arguments.description: starts a new file each time you start a new procedure.

arguments.name: NOTOC_DATA
arguments.description: Specify whether contents data is inserted into the RTF file

arguments.name: NOTRKEEP
arguments.description: Control whether table rows can be split by a page break

arguments.name: OPERATOR=
arguments.description: Insert the text that you specify into the metadata of the RTF file

arguments.name: text-string
arguments.description: is the text in the metadata of a file that indicates the author.

arguments.name: PACKAGE
arguments.description: Specify that the output from the destination be added to an ODS package

arguments.name: package-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of a package that was created with the ODS PACKAGE statement. If no name is specified, then the output is added to the unnamed package that was opened last.

arguments.name: PATH=
arguments.description: Specify the location of an aggregate storage location or a SAS catalog for all RTF files

arguments.name: 'aggregate-file-storage-location'
arguments.description: specifies an aggregate storage location such as directory, folder, or partitioned data set.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: is a file reference that has been assigned to an aggregate storage location. Use the FILENAME statement to assign a fileref.

arguments.name: libref.catalog
arguments.description: specifies a SAS catalog to write to.

arguments.name: URL=
arguments.description: specifies a URL for the file-specification.

arguments.name: Uniform-Resource-Locator
arguments.description: is the URL that you specify. ODS uses this URL instead of the filename in all the links and references that it creates to the file.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: specifies that no information from the PATH= option appears in the links or references.

arguments.name: PREPAGE=
arguments.description: Specify a text string that occurs before a table on a page

arguments.name: text-string
arguments.description: is the text at the top of the table, after the titles. The text is placed before any tables created by the procedure.

arguments.name: RECORD_SEPARATOR=
arguments.description: Specify an alternative character or string to separate lines in the output files

arguments.name: alternative-separator
arguments.description: represents one or more characters in hexadecimal or ASCII format. For example, the following option specifies a record separator of a carriage-return character and a linefeed character (on an ASCII file system):

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: produces RTF output that is appropriate for the environment in which you run the SAS job.

arguments.name: SASDATE
arguments.description: Write to the RTF file the time and date that you started your SAS session

arguments.name: STARTPAGE=
arguments.description: Control page breaks

arguments.name: BYGROUP
arguments.description: specifies to insert page breaks after each BY group.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: inserts a new page at the start of each procedure and within certain procedures, as is requested by the procedure code.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: instructs ODS not to insert any new pages at the start of each procedure or within certain procedures, even if the procedure code requests new pages. A new page begins only when a page is filled or when you specify STARTPAGE= NOW.

arguments.name: NOW
arguments.description: forces the immediate insertion of a new page.

arguments.name: STYLE=
arguments.description: Specify a style template to use in writing the RTF files

arguments.name: style-template
arguments.description: describes how to display the presentation aspects (color, font face, font size, and so on) of your SAS output. A style template determines the overall appearance of the documents that use that style template. Each style template consists of style elements.

arguments.name: TEXT=
arguments.description: Insert text into your RTF output

arguments.name: text-string
arguments.description: is the text that you want to insert into your RTF output. You can also use TEXT= to annotate other output.

arguments.name: TITLE=
arguments.description: Insert the text string that you want as your title into the metadata of a file

arguments.name: title-text
arguments.description: is the text in the metadata of a file that indicates the title.

arguments.name: TOC_DATA
arguments.description: Specify whether contents data is inserted into the RTF file

arguments.name: NOTOC_DATA
arguments.description: instructs ODS not to insert contents data into the RTF file.

arguments.name: TOC_DATA
arguments.description: instructs ODS to insert contents data into the RTF file.

name: ODS SELECT
description: Specifies output objects for ODS destinations.

arguments.name: output-object
arguments.description: specifies the output object to select.

arguments.name: (PERSIST)
arguments.description:
keeps the output-object that precedes the PERSIST option in the selection list, even if the DATA or procedure step ends, until you explicitly modify the list with one of the following:
• any ODS EXCLUDE statement 
• ODS SELECT NONE
• ODS SELECT ALL
• an ODS SELECT statement that applies to the same output object but does not specify PERSIST

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: specifies that ODS send all of the output objects to the open destination.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: specifies that ODS does not send any output objects to the open destination.

arguments.name: (NOWARN)
arguments.description: suppresses the warning that an output object was requested but not created.

arguments.description: specifies to which ODS destination's selection list to write, where ODS-destination can be any valid ODS destination except for the OUTPUT destination.

arguments.description: selects output objects that meet a particular condition. For example, the following statement selects only output objects with the word "Histogram" in their name:

arguments.name: _LABEL_
arguments.description: is the label of the output object.

arguments.name: _LABELPATH_
arguments.description: is the label path of the output object.

arguments.name: _NAME_
arguments.description: is the name of the output object.

arguments.name: _PATH_
arguments.description: is the name path of the output object.

arguments.name: operator
arguments.description: compares a variable with a value or with another variable. operator can be AND, OR NOT, OR, AND NOT, or a comparison operator.

name: ODS SHOW
description: Writes the specified selection or exclusion list to the SAS log.

arguments.name: ODS-destination
arguments.description: specifies which ODS destination's selection or exclusion list to write to the SAS log. ODS-destination must be a valid ODS destination. For information about ODS destinations, see . For information about selection and exclusion lists, see .

arguments.description: specifies another instance of the destination that is already open. identifier is numeric or a series of characters that begin with a letter or an underscore. Subsequent characters can include letters, underscores, and numeric characters.

arguments.name: IMAGE_DPI
arguments.description: Specify the image resolution for the graphical output

arguments.name: NEWFILE=
arguments.description: Create a new body file at the specified starting point

arguments.name: BYGROUP
arguments.description: starts a new file for the results of each BY group.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: writes all output to the body file that is currently open.

arguments.name: OUTPUT
arguments.description: starts a new file for each output object. For SAS/GRAPH this means that ODS creates a new file for each SAS/GRAPH output file that the program generates.

arguments.name: PROC
arguments.description: starts a new file each time you start a new procedure.

arguments.name: OPERATOR=
arguments.description: Insert the text that you specify into the metadata of the RTF file

arguments.name: text-string
arguments.description: is the text in the metadata of a file that indicates the author.

arguments.name: OPTIONS
arguments.description: Specify TAGSETS.RTF-specific options
arguments.help: OPTIONS (CONTENTS=CONTINUE_TAG= | DOC= | SECT= | TABLES_OFF= | TOC_DATA= | TOC_LEVEL= | TROWD= | TRHDR= | TROWHDRCELL= | VSPACE= | WATERMARK=)

arguments.name: (CONTENTS= 'YES')
arguments.description: produces a table of contents (TOC) page for RTF documents that are opened in Microsoft Word. The table of contents page contains a Table of Contents field that puts all of the contents information that is embedded in the document into a table of contents. To display the captured TOC data, you must turn on the option TOC_DATA. To expand the table of contents, right-click under the title in Microsoft Word and select Update Field from the selection list.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: adds a table of contents page to the top of the RTF file. This table of contents page is followed by a page break.

arguments.name: (CONTINUE_TAG ='''')
arguments.description: specifies whether to add a continue tag to the RTF file when a table breaks and is continued to the next page.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: instructs ODS to add a continue tag to the RTF file when a table breaks and is continued to the next page.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: instructs ODS not to add the continue tag when a table breaks and is continued to the next page.

arguments.name: (DOC=)
arguments.description: provides information about the tagset.

arguments.name: QUICK
arguments.description: describes the options available for this tagset.

arguments.name: HELP
arguments.description: provides generic help and information with a quick reference.

arguments.name: SETTINGS
arguments.description: provides the current option settings.

arguments.name: (SECT='''')
arguments.description: inserts RTF control words into the section data specifications.

arguments.name: rtf_control_string
arguments.description: specifies RTF control words used to format the section data.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: turns off the usage of RTF control words for the section data and resets the rtf_control_string to null.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: stops new RTF control words from being inserted into the file for the section data. ODS continues to use the section data information that was set before the use of NONE until it is reset.

arguments.name: (TABLES_OFF=''''
arguments.description: determines whether tables are used. A table can consist of one cell or many cells. SAS puts all of the text that you create into tables for RTF output. Use this suboption for tables that are text holders like titles, footnotes, and TEXT=. You should not use this suboption for tables produced by reporting procedures.

arguments.name: style_elements
arguments.description: specifies the style element for formatting. For example, the following statement turns off tables that use the USERTEXT style element. The text specified by the TEXT= option is not placed in the table.

arguments.name: STYLE_ELEMENTS
arguments.description: lists the output style elements in the SAS Log.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: turns the option off. Therefore, ODS places the information output next into the RTF file inside a table. This action is the default option.

arguments.name: (TOC_DATA ='''')
arguments.description: specifies whether to show the contents data in the RTF file.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: instructs ODS not to display the table of contents data in the RTF file.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: instructs ODS to display the hidden text of the table of contents in the RTF file.

arguments.name: (TOC_LEVEL ='')
arguments.description: Control the level of the expansion of the table of contents in RTF documents

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies the level of expansion. For example, TOC_LEVEL="0" results in a fully expanded table of contents. TOC_LEVEL="2" results in a table of contents that is expanded to two levels.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: restores all levels of expansion that are shown in the Table of Contents.

arguments.name: (TROWD=')
arguments.description: inserts raw RTF specifications directly into header descriptions of the table row.

arguments.name: rtf_control_string
arguments.description: specifies RTF control words and symbols.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: RTF controls are no longer inserted.

arguments.name: (TRHDR='')
arguments.description: inserts raw table row RTF specifications directly into the header description of the table row.

arguments.name: rtf_control_string
arguments.description: specifies Microsoft RTF control words or symbols.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: RTF controls are no longer inserted.

arguments.name: (TROWHDRCELL='')
arguments.description: inserts raw text into the table row cells. If the RTF Reader does not recognize this text_string, it applies the raw text to the location where the RTF is being written in the documentation. Otherwise, the RTF Reader interprets the text_string as RTF control words.

arguments.name: text_string
arguments.description: any text specified.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: inserts a null string. Text is no longer inserted.

arguments.name: (VSPACE='''')
arguments.description: specifies whether to add or remove space before and after tables.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: specifies that no space is added before and after tables in the RTF file.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: specifies that space is added before and after tables in the RTF file.

arguments.name: (WATERMARK=
arguments.description: inserts a watermark that is displayed diagonally across each page of the RTF document.

arguments.name: text_string
arguments.description: specifies the text string that appears diagonally across each page of the RTF document.
turns off the watermark text. Use a blank character within the quotation marks.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: appear as watermark text.

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: appear as watermark text.

arguments.name: PACKAGE
arguments.description: Specify that the output from the destination be added to an ODS package

arguments.name: package-name
arguments.description: specifies the name of a package that was created with the ODS PACKAGE statement. If no name is specified, then the output is added to the unnamed package that was opened last.

arguments.name: PAGEPANELS=
arguments.description: Specify the number of panels that are rendered for a multipanel table

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: specifies a positive integer.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: specifies that paneling is handled the same ways as traditional ODS RTF. That is, all of the first panel is written, then all of the second panel, and so on, until all of the table information is written.

arguments.name: PATH=
arguments.description: Specify the location of an aggregate storage location or a SAS catalog for all RTF files

arguments.name: 'aggregate-file-storage-location'
arguments.description: specifies an aggregate storage location such as directory, folder, or partitioned data set.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: is a file reference that has been assigned to an aggregate storage location. Use the FILENAME statement to assign a fileref.

arguments.name: libref.catalog
arguments.description: specifies a SAS catalog to write to.

arguments.name: URL=
arguments.description: specifies a URL for the file-specification.

arguments.name: Uniform-Resource-Locator
arguments.description: is the URL that you specify. ODS uses this URL instead of the filename in all the links and references that it creates to the file.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: specifies that no information from the PATH= option appears in the links or references.

arguments.name: PREPAGE=
arguments.description: Specify a text string that occurs before a table on a page

arguments.name: text-string
arguments.description: is the text at the top of the table, after the titles. The text is placed before any tables created by the procedure.

arguments.name: RECORD_SEPARATOR=
arguments.description: Specify an alternative character or string to separate lines in the output files

arguments.name: alternative-separator
arguments.description: represents one or more characters in hexadecimal or ASCII format. For example, the following option specifies a record separator of a carriage-return character and a linefeed character (on an ASCII file system):

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: produces RTF output that is appropriate for the environment in which you run the SAS job.

arguments.name: STARTPAGE=
arguments.description: Control page breaks

arguments.name: BYGROUP
arguments.description: specifies to insert page breaks after each BY group.

arguments.name: YES
arguments.description: inserts a new page at the start of each procedure and within certain procedures, as is requested by the procedure code.

arguments.name: NO
arguments.description: instructs ODS not to insert any new pages at the start of each procedure or within certain procedures, even if the procedure code requests new pages. A new page begins only when a page is filled or when you specify STARTPAGE= NOW.

arguments.name: NOW
arguments.description: forces the immediate insertion of a new page.

arguments.name: STYLE=
arguments.description: Specify a style template to use in writing the RTF files

arguments.name: style-template
arguments.description: describes how to display the presentation aspects (color, font face, font size, and so on) of your SAS output. A style template determines the overall appearance of the documents that use that style template. Each style template consists of style elements.

arguments.name: TABLEROWS=
arguments.description: Specify the number of rows that are rendered in a table

arguments.name: n
arguments.description: is a positive integer.

arguments.name: TEXT=
arguments.description: Insert text into your RTF output

arguments.name: text-string
arguments.description: is the text that you want to insert into your RTF output. You can also use TEXT= to annotate other output.

arguments.name: TRANTAB=
arguments.description: Specify a translation table to use when you transcode a file for output

arguments.name: UNIFORM
arguments.description: Specify that every page of a table is formatted the same

arguments.name: CLOSE
arguments.description: Close the destination and the file that is associated with it.

arguments.name: EXCLUDE
arguments.description: Exclude output objects from the destination

arguments.name: SELECT
arguments.description: Select output objects for the destination.

arguments.name: SHOW
arguments.description: Write to the SAS Log the current selection or exclusion list for the destination

name: ODS TEXT=
description: Inserts text into your ODS output.

arguments.name: text-string
arguments.description: specifies the text to insert into your output. This text is sent to all open output destinations.

name: ODS TRACE
description: Writes to the SAS log a record of each output object that is created, or suppresses the writing of this record.
help:
ODS TRACE   ON </options> ;
ODS TRACE   OFF;

arguments.name: OFF
arguments.description: turns off the writing of the trace record.

arguments.name: ON
arguments.description: turns on the writing of the trace record.

arguments.name: DOM
arguments.description: Specify that the ODS document object model is written to the SAS log or to an external file.

arguments.name: external-file
arguments.description: is the name of an external output file.

arguments.name: EXCLUDED
arguments.description: includes, in the trace record, information for excluded output objects.

arguments.name: LABEL
arguments.description: includes the label path for the output object in the record. You can use a label path anywhere that you can use a path.

name: ODS Tagset
description: Opens, manages, or closes the specified tagset destination.
help:
ODS  directory.tagset-name file-specification <options> ;
ODS  directory.tagset-name file-specification action;

arguments.name: directory
arguments.description: specifies the directory where the specified tagset is stored. directory can be a directory supplied by SAS, a user-defined entry, or a libref. By default, the tagsets that SAS supplies are located in the directory TAGSETS, which is within the item store Sashelp.Tmplmst.

arguments.name: CORE
arguments.description: contains a table of Unicode values and mnemonics. For a detailed description of using this tagset, see .

arguments.name: CSV
arguments.description: produces tabular output that contains columns of data values that are separated by commas.

arguments.name: CSVALL
arguments.description: produces output containing columns of data values that are separated by commas, and produces tabular output with titles, notes, and BY lines.

arguments.name: CSVBYLINE
arguments.description: produces output with comma-separated values and columns of data that are separated by commas.

arguments.name: DEFAULT
arguments.description: produces XML output.

arguments.name: ExcelXP
arguments.description: produces Microsoft spreadsheetML XML. This tagset is used to import data into Excel. Execute the following code to get detailed information about this tagset:

arguments.name: EVENT_MAP
arguments.description: creates XML output that shows which events are being triggered and which variables are used by an event to send output from a SAS process to an output file. When you run a SAS process with EVENT_MAP, ODS writes XML to an output file that shows all event names and variable names as tags. The output helps you create your own tagsets.

arguments.name: HTMLPANEL
arguments.description: creates panels for BY grouped graphs. It also has controls for semi-automatic and manually controlled paneling. This tagset makes it easy to put graphs and tables side-by-side on a page. Also included are controls for titles, footnotes, and BY lines.

arguments.name: NAMEDHTML
arguments.description: creates HTML output similar to STYLE_POPUP , but with all the objects labeled as they are when using ODS TRACE.

arguments.name: RTF
arguments.description: produces measured RTF. This tagset allows the user to specify how and where page breaks occur and when to place titles and footnotes into the body of a page. The RTF tagset enables SAS to place titles and footnotes into the body of the document so that it is outside of the control of Microsoft Word. Therefore, SAS becomes responsible for the implicit page breaks.

arguments.name: SHORT_MAP
arguments.description: creates a subset of the XML output that is created by the EVENT_MAP tagset.

arguments.name: STYLE_DISPLAY
arguments.description: creates a sample page of HTML output that is similar to STYLE_POPUP output. The output helps you create and modify styles.

arguments.name: STYLE_POPUP
arguments.description: displays the resolved ODS style template for any item that you select. This information is displayed in a window if you are using Internet Explorer.

arguments.name: TEXT_MAP
arguments.description: creates text output that shows which events are being triggered as ODS handles the output objects.

arguments.name: user-defined-tagset
arguments.description: specifies the tagset that you created using PROC TEMPLATE.

arguments.name: ANCHOR=
arguments.description: Specify a unique base name for the anchor tag that identifies each output object in the current body file

arguments.name: anchor-name
arguments.description: is the base name for the anchor tag that identifies each output object in the current body file.

arguments.name: ARCHIVE=
arguments.description: Specify which applet to use to view ODS HTML output

arguments.description: is the name of the attribute.

arguments.name: attribute-value
arguments.description: is the value of the attribute.

arguments.name: BASE=
arguments.description: Specify text to use as the first part of all links and references that ODS creates in output files

arguments.name: base-text
arguments.description: is the text that ODS uses as the first part of all links and references that ODS creates in the file. Consider this specification:

arguments.name: entry.markup

arguments.description: starts a new body file for each page of output. A page break occurs when a procedure explicitly starts a new page (not because the page size was exceeded) or when you start a new procedure.
